And finally, let me briefly update you on the Geberit  outlook. We expect for full-year total CapEx of CHF 180 million.

file: GEBN - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 12August2010 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Aug-10.pdf
GEBN - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 16August2011 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 16-Aug-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Our AquaClean initiatives launched two years ago and supported by dedicated B2C advertising campaigns and  AquaClean, additional financial and human resources. And finally, our participation at this year's ISH, Europe's  most important sanitary trade fair inflated our marketing costs. This fair take place every second year.

file: GEBN - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 14August2012 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Aug-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Turning now to the product groups, Sanitary Systems sales increased by 6.7%, with all product lines contributing  positively. Geberit AquaClean sales continued the strong trend of the previous quarters with a double-digit gain.  Piping Systems sales growth was 6.2%. Within Piping Systems, sales of building drainage systems dropped slightly  versus previous year's level.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Let me now summarize our outlook for this year. We are anticipating the prices for industrial metals to stabilize at  the current level. The feedstocks and commodity plastic prices remain highly volatile, with significant increases of  minimum 10% expected during Q3. Our Group sales growth in local currencies is expected to be in line with our  medium-term sales target of 4% to 6%. The EBITDA margin is expected to be at the upper end of our medium- term target corridor of 23% to 25%.

file: GEBN - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 13August2013 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 13-Aug-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: And now, a few words about the raw materials price evolution. The average price for commodity plastic in H1 2013  was flat compared to the first half last year, with some price slightly below previous year's level and others, like the  price of polystyrene being significantly higher than one year ago.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: For the second half of this year, the price trend for commodity plastics is uncertain with spot ethylene and  propylene prices moving up in August, combined with a tight polyethylene supply in Europe.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: All industrial metals prices were, in H1, below previous year's levels. And we don't expect any significant changes  during the second half of this year. In general, the visibility is still limited, and any unexpected political or  economic event could change the picture rapidly and drastically.

texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: And now, a few words about the raw materials price environment. The average price for commodity plastics are  showing some marginal upside improvements and we expect a base metals' price diffe rentiation, with prices  trending up for aluminum, nickel and zinc and the copper price underperforming most of the base metals.

file: GEBN - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 12August2015 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Aug-15.pdf

texts.text: And now a few words about the raw material price environment. Metal  raw materials are forecasted to be lower in Q3 than in Q2. Overall, we expect stable raw material costs in Q3  versus Q2; and for the full year 2015, raw material costs slightly below previous year's level.

For the full year 2017, we expect raw  material prices to be substantially above previous year's level.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: And now let me summarize our views about the various outlooks for the building industry. In Europe, it is hard to  see any recovery and the individual markets and sectors will continue to develop very differently. No fundamental  change in Germany, Switzerland, Norway and Russia with a positive trend, but with some initial signs of  slowdown in Germany, with the deterioration of the business climate index in September. We also assess the  business environment in Russia less positively than a few months ago.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: And now, a few words about the raw materials price environment. The average price for commodity plastic in H1  this year was flat when compared to H1 2012. During Q3, some prices trended up and are now back to the second  quarter level. There were diverging signs and we find no clear evidence supporting the trend.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Chairman, CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Base metals prices are below previous year levels and we don't expect any significant changes as supply growth is  likely to run ahead of demand in the next quarters. However, there is a range of uncertainties that make reading  price direction difficult.

file: GEBN - Q3 2014 Earnings Call 30October2014 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Nov-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.text: And now a few words about the raw material price environment. We expect stable average prices for the  commodity plastics and the base metal price outlooks are uncertain and diverse.

file: GEBN - Q3 2015 Earnings Call 27October2015 500 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Oct-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.text: As we introduced, AquaClean Mera in September, we spent this year more marketing in Q3 than in other years.  Raw material cost in Q3 was at Q2 level and slightly below prior year. We had a significant pickup in plastic prices  in Q2, which also impacted Q3.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The fifth growth driver is our focus on innovation to support our technology penetration, the value strategy and  also our AquaClean initiative. The last but equally important driver is our ability to continuously improve business  processes and to optimize the cost structure.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The second growth driver will remain our focus on technology penetration in various areas. In all our product  lines, we are striving to replace outdated technologies with new products and innovations. We are, for example,  substituting copper and cheap plastic piping systems with our multi-layered supply pipes. At the same time, we  are promoting pressing technologies to connect pipes instead of soldering and welding, which are outdated  techniques, more time-consuming and also less secure.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Wall-hung toilets with concealed cistern have obvious advantages. They have a much nicer design. They are space- saving, and they are easier to clean. Driving the technology from the left to the right on this picture was in the past  and will also, be in the future, a key driver to outperform the construction markets.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Our sixth key strategic driver is our continuous business process optimization. A good example is the optimization  of our actuator plate production in our manufacturing site in Jona in Switzerland. We fully automated the  manufacturing process from plastic injection molding to assembly, quality control, packaging and logistics. The  process is now fully automated, and we are able to increase the capacity by 70% to reduce head count and to  reduce production costs by more than 60%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Thirdly, we will extend our value strategy to the ceramics and complementary product portfolio. Fourthly, the  acquired ceramics know-how, the manufacturing capacity and the better access to showrooms will contribute and  support our AquaClean initiative. Fifthly, we'll leverage the combined know-how in installation technology from  Geberit and bathroom ceramics from Sanitec to develop new innovative product solutions. And finally, we will  rollout our proven approach and tools for business process optimization to the ceramics operations network.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Let me now comment our Geberit outlook for the full year 2015. We expect the Geberit organic net sales growth to  be in the range between 2% and 3% for the full year 2015 as communicated with our H1 results and Sanitec's net  sales below previous year's level. And we expect an adjusted EBITDA margin for the whole year of around 26%.  Average raw material prices in Q4 are expected to be below Q3 driven by decreasing plastics and also decreasing  metal prices.

texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Member of the Group Executive Board, Geberit AG
texts.text: And now a few words about the raw material price with our environment. Overall, we expect the increase in price  trend since H2 to continue with average raw material prices in Q4 2016 to be above Q3 2016 level driven by  increasing prices [indiscernible] (12:23) raw materials. For the full-year 2016, we expect raw material prices still to  be the below previous year's level.

Average raw material in the fourth quarter 2017 is expected to be above Q3, driven by higher  plastic prices and higher metal prices. For the full year 2017, we expect raw material prices to be clearly above  previous year's level.

But keep in mind that raw material price level in Q4 will be  substantially above Q4 level last year due to the continued increase of price level during the last nine months.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: A number of new products were launched last year. The new Geberit Monolith elegant alternative  to the traditional exposed cistern, a new collection of electronic lavatory taps was also launched. A  further innovation was the wall drain for floor-even showers and Geberit AquaClean initiatives was  consequently continued.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: The absolute environmental impact increased by 3.3%, compared to the previous year, a  consequence of higher production volume and an infrastructure extension. The greenhouse gas  emissions increased by 4.3%.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: We started saving measures. The consumption of fresh water was reduced by 42% since 2006.  The slight increase of fresh water consumption compared to last year results from activities related  to the business start-up of our new Asia headquarter in Shanghai.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: Since 2008 social aid projects were realized in Cambodia, Indonesia, Ecuador, the Solomon  Islands and last year in India. In our social projects we focused on the topics of water and  sanitation. Last year donations and financial contributions totaled CHF3.1 million.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: The main reasons for the cost increase are on the one side a base effect, because during the crisis  year 2009 the cost base was extraordinarily low. And on the other side our investments in future  sales growth as, for example, the AquaClean marketing campaign. Compensating effects had a  continuously strict cost control and efficiency increasing measures as, for example, the start-up of  our new logistics center in Southern Germany at the beginning of 2010.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer  Thank you, Roland. This year we launched several new products primarily in the business area of  Sanitary Systems. The Geberit DuoFresh is a simple, effective, and environmentally friendly  solution to thoroughly eliminate any odor in the toilet. With this new product, odor extraction occurs  in the ceramic bowl with air being suctioned out and purified through an active carbon filter situated  behind the actuator plate.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: The new actuator plate Sigma60 can be installed surface-even with the wall. This plate fulfills the  sophisticated standards of architects in the design of aesthetic high-end bathrooms. When  retrofitting a conventional basis system with Geberit AquaClean, changes to the building structure  should be avoided. Design covers make a quick jump of retrofitting without changes to the building  structure.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: Now, I would like to continue with the outlook for Geberit. We have four growth drivers: First, our  current standard business, second, the so-called organic growth initiatives, third, innovation with  new products, and fourth, the Geberit AquaClean initiative.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: In the period, 2009 until 2014, we are expecting to generate around 25% of our total sales growth  with the current product portfolio. 40% of the total sales growth should be contributed by our  organic growth initiatives. The new product sales contribution should cover around 20% and the  Geberit AquaClean initiative should deliver a sales growth of 15%.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: And now a few comments to our Geberit AquaClean initiative. In Asia, in particularly in Japan and  South Korea, a higher market penetration with shower toilets already exists. China has a much  lower market penetration. However, the market is growing very rapidly. In Europe, the product  category is in fact unknown.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good morning. Good morning, ladies and gentlemen and welcome to our Analyst Conference. I’ll
texts.text: Geberit AquaClean strategy is to create the European shower toilet category and to be the market  leader. To reach this goal, we are investing a lot in marketing and sales initiatives. A few examples,  part of our goal to make the Geberit AquaClean product visual our flagship locations, high profile  locations in two European cities have been selected.

file: GEBN - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 8March2012 500 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 09-Mar-12.pdf

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Net income fell by 5.6% to CHF 384 million. This corresponds to an earning per share of CHF 9.82. The free cash  flow of CHF 386 million represents the third highest figure in Geberit's history. At the General Assembly Meeting  on April 4, the board of directors will propose a withholding tax free distribution from reserves from capital  contributions in the amount of CHF 6.30. This represents an increase of 5% over the distribution of exactly CHF 6  per share last year. The payout ratio of 63.7% of net income is in the middle range of the targeted 50% to 70%.  During the past year, we launched a series of promising new products. With the Geberit DuoFresh, air is removed  out directly from the ceramic and thoroughly purified by a filter. This is convenient and very environmentally  friendly as less ventilation is required. Our new actuator plates meet the very highest demands of architects and  design oriented end-users. The design plate facilitates easy replacement of a traditional toilet with the Geberit  AquaClean without changes in the building structure. We designed a new concealed cistern especially for our  customers in Australia. It is particularly thin and optimized for prevailing local construction practices.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Absolute environmental impact increased somewhat by 0.4% over the year, as a result of the significant increased  production volume. This must be considered against the backdrop of the strong sales development in local  currencies. We were able to reduce greenhouse gas emissions by nearly 1% and keep the recycling rate at a very  high level. Water consumption did increase slightly over the past year, but is still 40% lower than five years ago.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Since 2008, social aid projects have been undertaken in Cambodia, Indonesia, Ecuador, The Solomon Islands,  India and last year in Serbia. The subjects of water and sanitary technology always play a central role in our social  aid projects. Geberit made donations and financial contributions in the amount of CHF 2.7 million last year.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: With these new products, Geberit is offering a small power station complete with a power storage unit. The  running water is sufficient to supply electric taps with electricity. This makes installation and operation easier.  The plumber needs no electrical connection and no batteries need to be replaced anymore during operation.

texts.speaker: Roman Sidler
texts.text: I would like to show you two different parts of this magazine. One is the one of the self-sustaining power supply,  which was introduced by Albert Baehny. That's the intro again.

texts.speaker: Roman Sidler
texts.text: Next page is again a nice picture, [ph] Pietsbolieu (23:40) in Switzerland. But also already here, some words to the  sustainability aspect of this product. We are very happy to also be able to push items like this in this magazine.  And next level then is a shot of the product, some technical information, as well as a price we got for that. And  then a nice gadget. As you can see here by wiping this product here, you get an inside view of this product.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Now allow me to comment on the outlook for Asia. In China, the Government interventions to curb overheating  are beginning to show their effects. And we are anticipating a cooling down in the residential construction sector.  We don't believe, however, that there will be any hard landing. Commercial construction projects are continuing  to exhibit robust development.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: I have already spoken about the new products. I will now concentrate on the Geberit AquaClean initiative and also  on targeted other activities. Most of you will already be familiar with our organic growth initiatives. These targeted  sales initiatives have been making a positive contribution to growth at Geberit for the last two years and we will  continue these successful initiatives in nine markets in 2012.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: We continued to move the AquaClean campaign forward at full force in 2011. We continue to pursue the strategy  goal of expanding the shower toilet category in Europe, and of establishing ourselves as the market leader. To this  end, we invested in marketing and made a few years ago, the strategic decision to in source production. This was  implemented last year by founding the Geberit Apparate AG. With the beginning of the production in Jona, we  have concentrated the know-how for AquaClean at one single size. Thanks to innovative processes in production  and logistics, we have also succeeded in further optimizing cost.  Following more than two years of careful preliminary work, we were able to begin AquaClean production in Jona  in November. Since then, complete solutions and seats are being manufactured. We invested CHF 10 million and  created 60 new jobs.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: What are the future hold for AquaClean? In terms of 2012, once again we have set ourselves a number of goals. We  will continue to intensively advertise our shower toilets to end-users in the existing campaign markets. Moreover,  Belgium, Denmark and Norway will be added to the campaign this year. We also want to continue to grow our  standard business. We see great potential in the further development of our branding, and in a further cultivation  of our partnership with the plumbers.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: CEO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: The prices of raw materials were exceptionally volatile in recent years. We are anticipating an uncertain  development once again in the present year. Commodity and specialty plastics in particular show a clear tendency  towards increasing prices. This is also partly true for industrial metals.

file: GEBN - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 12March2013 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Mar-13.pdf

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Despite currency-adjusted group-wide growth of 4.5%, the total environment impact declined by 5.1%. The strong  increase in sourcing ecological electricity as well as the first-time usage of biogas significantly reduced the  environmental impact. Successes could also be recorded with respect to other ecological factors.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Geberit apprentices and their custodians spent two weeks in Port Elizabeth to renew the sanitary facilities in a  township school, additionally, their broad, basic know-how about hygiene and the handing of water to 850  children. Together with the SwissWaterKiosk, a pilot project for secure water treatment was supported in  Bangladesh, and the cooperation with the development organization, Helvetas, was also continued last year. 13  years after the going public, Geberit was accepted to the SMI, the most important Swiss stock index. I see this  advancement primarily as credit to the great work of the Geberit employees.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Similar to the Sigma50, the Sigma10 family was reworked with a new modern design, including the integration of  a new flush/stop function. All touchless actuator plate Sigma10 are equipped with a dual-flush technology for  which the Sigma10 was awarded with six stars of the sustainability label, WELL.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: The new shower toilet Geberit AquaClean Sela compels through simple and modern lines its innovative  technology and high level of comfort. With this, we expand our successful range of shower toilets with a  fundamentally redesigned complete solution. The entire technology, as well as the connections for electricity and  water supply are integrated into the ceramic body. Installation and service are very easy to perform. The market  introduction in April this year will be supported by a new marketing campaign and websites.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: As mentioned already, the new AquaClean Sela will be introduced in April this year. Design as a topic is gaining  importance in the bathroom; however, it is not about fancy products, but rather about products with harmonious  proportion, high-quality materials and sophisticated technology. These aspects define the approach given to the  development of the AquaClean Sela. The new shower toilets must fit naturally into every bathroom, and we  succeeded in achieving this. AquaClean Sela looks like a normal toilet.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: We are launching a new campaign with Melanie Winiger as ambassador for the introduction of this AquaClean  Sela. This campaign is based on four modules with four different topics; hygiene, freshness, cleanliness, and well- being.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: A large number of initiatives will be pursued in several areas to further increase our productivity and improve our  cash position. A consistent customer management is being pursued since several years. This approach will be  extended to new markets. A specific CRM tool has been developed for our AquaClean business and will be  introduced this year.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: Head-Finance & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: In the past years, the raw material prices have been very volatile. At the moment, we see no clear and stable price  trend, neither for plastics nor for industrial metals. For the coming three months, the copper price forecast raised  from $7,700 to $9,000 per metric ton, a volatility of 17%.

file: GEBN - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 11March2014 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Mar-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: Our portfolio of actuator plates was completed. The Sigma10 family, picture on the left, includes the full range for  WCs and urinals and has been certified as water efficiency at highest level. Furthermore, it allows touchless flush  activation.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: The new design of the Sigma60, picture on the right, now comes with frameless plates. Beside the convincing  weight reduction, the new electric welding machine for drainage pipes also allows for faster change of tools. The  new version of the Geberit Pluvia roof-drainage system combines the existing advantages with a significant noise  emission reduction. The total environmental impact declined by 2.1% despite currency -adjusted group-wide sales  growth of 3.6%. We also achieved the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and water consumption by 2.7 %,  respectively 3.5% versus the previous year. It's also worth noting that the Geberit recycled 84% of all production - related waste.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: The product line with high sales, installation systems, developed most favorab ly with the sales growth of 5.2% in  local currencies. Within Piping Systems, building drainage systems enjoyed the strongest development with 5.1%  sales growth.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.profession: CFO & Investor Relations Contact, Geberit AG
texts.text: Marketing expenses, which in the last years due to the AquaClean campaign and growth initiatives, have been  growing significantly were down by almost 4% in 2013. In total, other operating expenses increased by 3.6%,  which is slightly less in the 2013 sales growth.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: Floor-even showers are very trendy. The innovative wall-drain that was introduced by Geberit in 2011 allows  location of the drainage in the wall, the new and revised Geberit wall-drain is even less obtrusive, slimmer and it  can be easily installed almost anywhere.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: The Geberit Monolith WC module has enjoyed great popularity since its introduction in 2010. This year, we will  introduce the Geberit Monolith Plus. In addition to the flushing system, it includes odor extrac tion directly from  the toilet bowl, programmable orientation lighting, and electronic flush activation.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: Our R&D department applies computer simulations for example to improve the flow behaviors of our water  drainage systems. One example of that research is the new patented Geberit Sovent fitting, which increases the  flow performance by 40%. It permits the use of relatively small-sized discharge specs even in a very high building  and has allowed us to save space and reduce costs.

texts.speaker: Albert M. Baehny
texts.profession: Executive Chairman & Chief Executive Officer, Geberit AG
texts.text: The newly built production facility in Ruse, Slovenia will replace the current existing plant, which we moved into  in 1965. As already mentioned in the review, the ground breaking of the new site took place in April last year.  Today, the new facility is already considered a reference for green production in Slovenia. In parallel, new  production flows will increase the productivity. The new plant should start production in the third quarter of this  year.

file: GEBN - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 10March2015 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-Mar-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In addition, we expanded in 2014 our Geberit Monolith family. We introduced WC module Monolith Plus with  odor extraction directly from the toilet bowl, orientation light and electronic flush activation.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In China, we introduced a Monolith washbasin module, developed especially for the middleclass that is entirely  produced in China. The module is available with four different options with different ceramics and faucets.  Further, we introduced new and revised Geberit valve drain system, slimmer in design and even easier and safer  to install. As an example, for our regular extensions of our pipe in product portfolio, we introduced in 2014 the  patent Geberit Sovent fitting. The Sovent fitting increases the flow performance by 40% and hence enables  relatively small sized drainage stacks especially for high rise buildings.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: A second key investment in 2014 was the expansion of our Italian production site in Villadose. In Villadose, we  produced our Geberit drainage pipes. The expansion addresses the volume growth in this important product line.  The total investments amounted to €12 million as we took up production in October 2014.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In addition to the 50th anniversary we further invested into our customer relationships. As an example, the slide  shows our customer activities 2014 in Germany. In total, we conducted 60,000 individual customer visits with our  sales force. On top, more than 10,000 customers participated in one of our 200 events in Germany, addressing  specific topics for example training on fire protection with live demonstrations, or sales trainings for Geberit  AquaClean or new product demonstration with our On Tour events.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The total environment impact declined further by 1.6% despite the currency adjusted sales growth of 6.4%. We  also achieved a reduction of greenhouse gas emissions and water consumption by 1% respectively, 0.5% versus the  previous year, and our recycling rate increased further and reached 85%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: All product lines contributed to growth, this positive growth rates in local currencies. The product line with the  highest sales levels the installation systems grew by 7.5%. Building drainage systems showed the strongest  development with almost double digit growth.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: I will now make a few comments on the key product introductions in 2015. We will introduce in 2015 a new  premium shower toilet, the AquaClean Mera. You see the picture on the slide. The new Mera combines innovative  technology, comfort and design. Smart comfort functions such as an automatic WC lid, seat heating and an  orientation light are combined with a rimless ceramic toilet bowl to ensure highest standards for cleanness and  hygiene. The market introduction of Mera will be in September this year.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In the product area of piping systems, we will introduce a new hygiene flush system to avoid stagnating water in  drinking water systems. The automated flushing ensures safety and highest quality of drinking water in all  buildings, especially in public buildings like hotels, hospitals or schools. The hygiene flush can be easily operated  with the Geberit app on standard mobile phones.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Another important product introduction this year for drainage systems is the new shower channel CleanLine for  four even showers. From an end-user perspective, the CleanLine convinces with an elegant design and an easy and  practical way of cleaning. The advantages for the installers are an easy and secure installation.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The acquisition is a combination of two complementary businesses fit into the European sanitary market. Geberit  today is based on sanitary technology and focusing on technology products installed primarily behind the wall.

file: GEBN - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 15March2016 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 18-Mar-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Last year, we again introduced various new products. Among others, we introduced our new premium shower  toilet AquaClean Mera on the left side on this slide. The new Mera combines innovative technology, comfort and  design. Smart comfort functions such as an automatic WC lid, seat heating or an orientation light are combined  with rimless ceramic to ensure highest standards for cleanness and hygiene.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In addition, we introduced in 2015, a new hygiene floor system in the product area of piping systems to avoid  stagnating water in buildings. The automated flushing ensures safety and highest quality of drinking water  especially in public buildings like hotels, hospitals or schools. The hygiene flush can be easily operated with a  Geberit app on standard mobile phones.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Also in 2015, we heavily invested in deepening the relationship with our customers and partners at various events.  Among others, we informed more than 2,000 planners and installers about our new products and new regulations  regarding drainage systems at the Geberit Abwasser-FaCHF orum. Also related to our piping systems, we  conducted specific noise protection events for our top decision makers in various countries from Scandinavia to  UK and several Adriatic countries. In addition, to these events, we further invested into our customer  relationships. As an example, the slide shows our customer activities 2015 in Germany. In total, we conducted  60,000 individual customer visits. On top of that, more than 20,000 customers participated in one of our more  than 300 events addressing specific topics. For example, training on fire protection, with live demonstrations,  special sales trainings for Geberit AquaClean or new product demonstrations with our Geberit on Tour event  series. Finally, we attracted thousands of customers at more than 500 trade fairs in Germany.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The total environmental impact, excluding Sanitec, declined further last year by a 2.1%, despite the currency- adjusted sales growth of 2.7%. At the same time, the environmental impact's strongly increased by a factor of four  due to the acquisition of Sanitec. The strong increase is mainly due to the much higher energy consumption for  ceramics manufacturing. In the context of our social engagement, we funded and carried out, again, a social  project in 2015.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: I would like now to give you an outlook on the current year at Geberit. And I will start with our new product  introductions 2016. We are introducing this year, a new urinal system with a rimless ceramic and integrated flush  control. This new urinal system is the first urinal with easy maintenance, due to outstanding access, service and  repair concept. Furthermore, the new urinal is highly sustainable and economical since the operator can decide on  the flushing volume and the source for power supply.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In the area of piping systems, we introduced a new highly sound-insulating drainage system. The so-called, Silent- Pro piping system reduces undesired noise from neighboring apartments and bathrooms. And the system's easy  and safe to install due to the well-known plug-in connection technology.

file: GEBN - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 14March2017 700 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Mar-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Furthermore, it is highly sustainable and economical since the operator can decide on the flushing volume and to  source for power supply. In the product area of piping, we introduced a new highly sound-insulating drainage  system. The Silent-Pro piping system reduces undesired noise from neighboring apartments, and it's easy and  safe to install due to the well-known blocking connection technology.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Also, from the environmental perspective, 2016 was a successful year. The environmental impact in relation to  net sales declined by 10.8%. We reduced the total energy consumption by 5.2% in 2016. CO2 emissions in  relation to net sales declined by 9.9%, mainly driven by energy efficiency measures in the ceramics plant network.  Over a period of 10 years, which you see on the slide here, we were able to reduce the relative environmental  impact by 49%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In the context of our social engagement, we funded and carried out social projects again in 2016. For example, 17  Geberit employees worked as part of a volunteering project together with local people in a community in Western  Nepal, and supported the construction work of a water pipeline. This project was a cooperation with Helvetas in  Nepal, and included financial funding by Geberit.

texts.speaker: Roland Iff
texts.text: The favorable development of raw material prices has definitely come to an end in 2016. The relevant raw  material spot prices decreased from Q2 2015 until beginning of 2016. Later in 2016, they showed a different  development. Plastic prices moved more or less sideways, whereas industrial metals showed a strong price  increase. For some of the materials, a significant part of this move happened in the fourth quarter. For H1 2017,  we therefore expect higher purchasing prices. In addition, the appreciation of the U.S. dollar will also have a  negative impact on our purchasing prices as most of our raw material prices are quoted in U.S. dollars.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: I would like now to give you an outlook on the current year at Geberit. I will start with our product introductions this  year. We introduced a new mid-level shower toilet called AquaClean Tuma. The new Tuma convinces with a  compact design. Furthermore, it will be equipped with several comfort functions, such as seat heating, odor  extraction, and a warm air dryer. It will also include several technical features, for example, a rimfree ceramic  bowl. There will be two types available: a complete solution with seat and ceramic together and the version with  the seat only.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In 2017, we also introduced a new floor even shower tray called Setaplano. The product offers benefits for end  users and for installers. The end-user benefits are an easy-to-clean surface and an easy-to-clean drainage outlet.  The advantages for installers are a fast and particularly safe installation due to a pre-assembled installation  element with an integrated sealing foil.

file: GEBN - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 13March2018 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 14-Mar-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: This is a new concept for all customers along the entire value chain, where we presented our combined product  portfolio. Another example, are the Geberit Drainage Competence events. We organized 68 of these events with  more than 2,200 customers. We adapted this already existing concept for installers and planers, to focus on our  new highly sound insulating drainage system called Silent-Pro.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Let me give you a few examples of our digital marketing activities last year. Building Information Modeling  abbreviated as BIM is rapidly gaining importance in the construction industry. We set up a dedicated team  responsible for completing and maintaining BIM data for our entire assortment. Furthermore, we started to  develop intelligent plugins for BIM software, for example for the planning and calculation of our roof drainage  systems.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: The third product which I want to show here is in the product area of showers where we introduced a new floor  even shower tray called Setaplano. The end consumer benefits from an easy to clean surface and drainage  outlet. The advantages for installers are a faster and particularly safe installation due to pre-assembled installation  elements with an integrated sealing foil.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In piping, we introduced a new supply piping press system called Volex. It is a price competitive system,  especially for the European expansion markets.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: And finally, in Sanitary Ceramics, we introduced Acanto, a complete bathroom series with an organic design and  Slim Rim washbasins. An important advantage for installers is an easy and fast installation of the ceramics.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Besides large investment projects, many smaller continuous improvement projects are an important pillar of our  strategy. Let me give you a few examples of improvement projects in our ceramics plants last year. In Wloclawek  in Poland, we modernized our kiln and reduced energy consumption by 5%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Also from an environmental perspective, 2017 was a successful year. Despite higher production volumes, we  reduced total energy consumption by 4.2%. The environmental impact in relation to net sales declined organically  by 6.1%. CO2 emissions in relation to net sales declined organically by 5.8% mainly driven by energy-efficiency  measures in the ceramics plant network. Over a period of 10 years, we were able to reduce the relative  environmental impact by 45%. In the context of our social engagement, we again funded and carried out social  projects in 2017. For example, Geberit apprentices went to Odessa in Ukraine to support a vocational school with  500 students. They renovated the sanitary facilities and other common/recreation rooms.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Per end of 2016, more than 0.5 million dwellings were planned and approved in Germany, but not yet built. This  lack of capacity also led to an increased construction time for both single- and multi-family buildings, which you  see here at the bottom right. The sanitary construction sector is even more affected by the lack of capacity, since  the sanitary installer job is one of the most qualified jobs on a construction site.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Piping Systems sales increased by 3.8% to CHF 866 million. The strong growth of Drainage Piping Systems with  8.6% was driven by a consequent upsetting of our product portfolio and new product introductions. Sanitary  Ceramics sales declined by 2.3% to CHF 681 million, negatively affected by the closure of the two ceramic sites  in France and a weaker market environment in the Nordic region.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Another new product this year is the new fill valve for flushing cisterns. It fits into Geberit and OEM flushing  cisterns and fulfils highest quality standards, for example, with low noise level or resistance against dirt and  chemical substances.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In the product area of piping, we introduced a new sanitary flush system called Rapid. Rapid allows to  automatically flush water in supply Piping Systems at regular intervals to avoid hygiene risks arising from  stagnating water. Due to the compact design and the fast pre-wall installation, Rapid is also a solution for retrofit  or if hygiene is acutely at risk.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Another innovation this year in the product area of piping is an energy retaining valve for wastewater ventilation.  This valve is installed on top of drainage stack on the rooftop of a building to avoid heating and energy losses  through the wastewater ventilation stack, that's this one here. The solution saves up to 50 liters of heating oil per  year and such drainage stack.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: A third key investment is the capacity increase and efficiency improvement of our production site for installation  system in Lichtenstein, Eastern Germany. As you can see in this little movie, we build a new automated welding  line for metal frames and optimized our processes. The efficiency measures lead also to head count reduction  and have a payback of two years. Total investments amount to €5 million. Do you want to finish it?

file: GEBN - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 12March2019 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 12-Mar-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Let me give you two examples of customer events we carried out last year. We organized so-called Geberit  Sicher dabei! events for 18,000 professional customers. The event focused on the fire and noise protection topics,  drinking water hygiene and wastewater hydraulics in the context of sanitary planning and the regulatory and  normative environment. Another example is the Blogger@AquaCleanSpace event as part of our Showroom Pull  and social media activities. We organized six workshops with 40 bloggers to

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: We have again introduced several new products in 2018. In Bathroom Systems, we introduced a washbasin  range called VariForm, a comprehensive portfolio of countertop washbasins in different geometrical forms and in  a universal and timeless design. Another product introduction was the automated flushing system, Rapid, for  supply piping systems to avoid hygiene risks. In the product area of Piping Systems, we introduced an energy  saving valve to be put on the top of a drainage stack. This valve saves up to 50 liter of heating oil per year and  drainage stack. In the product line of shower toilet, we launched Tuma Classic, an entry-level shower toilet at end  consumer price levels of around CHF 1,500. This shower toilet is also controllable via an app on a smartphone.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Let me highlight some of our key investment projects last year. Since 2017, we completely renew our production  site for our metal supply pipe systems in Langenfeld, Germany. We built two new buildings for production and  administration. In total, we invested €35 million into the infrastructure and the completion is as planned for spring  2019. Another project is in Ozorkow in Poland, where we extended our factory to manufacture labor intense metal  fittings, which were transferred from our site in Germany. The investment amounts to €9 million and the payback  is three years. Start of production in Poland is also planned for 2019.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Beside productivity improvements in our metal and plastics plants, we also invested systematically into our  ceramics plants. Let me give you a few examples of improvement projects in our ceramics plants last year. In  Kolo, Poland, we invested in two new robotic glazing lines, which increased productivity by 18%. Furthermore, we  significantly improved the working conditions by this investment. Total investment amounted to CHF 2 million.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: 2018 was also from an environmental perspective a good year. Despite higher production volumes, we reduced  the total energy consumption by 4.6%. The environmental impact in relation to sales declined by 7.3% in 2018  and CO2 emissions in relation to sales declined by 7.5%, mainly driven by further energy efficiency measures in  our ceramics plants. Since the acquisition of Sanitec in 2015, we reduced the relative environment impact of the  combined companies by remarkable 22%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Now, I would like to give you an outlook on the current year at Geberit. I will start with our new product  introductions this year. Our new bathroom series, Geberit ONE, is the first bathroom series combining the know- how behind the wall and the ceramics competence in front of the wall. The new bathroom series offers multiple  benefits for end consumers but also for installers. End consumers benefit for example from space saving  solutions, thanks to an in-wall siphon for the wash basin, or more hygiene due to a turbo-flush integrated in the  toilet. The benefits for installers are easier, faster and safer installation, for example, due to a height-adjustable  WC or a complete new fixing systems for the toilet. The new series with the launch this year in Germany,  Switzerland, Austria, Belgium and Luxembourg.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: In line with Geberit ONE, we will also introduce a new DuoFresh module this year. DuoFresh is an odor  extraction, which extracts bad odors directly out of the toilet; and, secondly, provides hygienic flushing water. The  main benefits of this new DuoFresh solution are an automatic activation when the end consumer uses the toilet;  secondly, the compatibility with almost all actuator plate designs; and thirdly, the connectivity to a smartphone via  an app. Furthermore, the DuoFresh is now fully compatible with our standard WC elements and retrofittable back  until 2008.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: For the product line of shower toilets, we will introduce the new AquaClean Sela. The new Sela is positioned in  the mid-price level and focuses on hygiene and design, for example ,with an atmospheric orientation light.  Additionally, the new Sela will also be controllable via an app on a smartphone. The introduction of Sela marks  now the end of the complete renewal of our shower toilet portfolio over the last four years. We now have a  complete product range addressing all customer needs from functionality to design and also all price points from  entry level up to premium level.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: An important product introduction in Piping Systems this year are the new SuperTube fittings for drainage  systems. SuperTube fittings ensure an air column in the drainage stack. This allows for space saving in high-rise  buildings since there's no need for a separate ventilation pipe and the slope of the horizontal pipes can be  reduced. With SuperTube, the shaft size for drainage pipes can be reduced up to 20% and the thickness of a  false ceiling reduced up to 40%.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: Let me now come to some of our key investment projects this year. We are currently in the progress to completely  renew our production site for Piping Systems in Langenfeld as already mentioned. After the completion of the  buildings, we renew in 2019 the machinery and equipment. We will invest €17 million into the new equipment.  Due to the strong growth of drainage pipe systems, we will increase the capacity in our production plant for plastic  pipes in Villadose in Italy. At the same time, we will also further increase efficiency in the plant. In total, we invest  €4 million and expect the payback of four years.

texts.speaker: Christian Buhl
texts.text: A second important marketing topic this year will be the further rollout of our digital tools along our digital  roadmap. We will launch our new Geberit Pro app for installers with new functionalities. For example, with an  automated product identification based on artificial intelligence or a chat function for installers. Furthermore, we  will introduce new web-based calculation tools for planners and also for installers, for example, for the calculation  of sound insulation. These tools will also be available directly in our Geberit Pro app hence on smartphones.

texts.speaker: Emmanuel Moulin
texts.text: Let me talk now to our different businesses. First, the rail freight activity. We are the number one private rail  freight operator in the UK and France. We haul about 1,100 trains per week. We are present in railway logistic, in  hauling of trains, and in management of railway infrastructure, in particular, in ports. Our business has increased  and expanded during 2014 with a number of contracts that we've been able to record. In France, we transport  fertilizer. We transport clinker. We transport lime. We transport fuel for oilseeds for a number of clients. We have  diversified our client base. So we are much less dependent on the limited number of clients. And so this mitigates  the risk of losing one client by having a diversified investor base.

texts.speaker: Emmanuel Moulin
texts.text: We are making progress on our [ph] existing (43:40) project, which is an electricity interconnection between  France and the UK running through the tunnel. It's a very good way for us to optimize the use of our  infrastructure and the use of our assets. It's a joint venture between Eurotunnel and our partner Star Capital. The  project is 1,000 megawatt interconnection between the UK and France.

texts.speaker: Emmanuel Moulin
texts.text: We have gone through the regulatory process with, in particular, the clearance by the national regulators and by  the European Commission in 2014. The projects will be based on contracts to transport electricity. Part of it being  long-term contracts. We have launched the expression of interest from customers in 2014, and we have a strong  response. We are, at the moment, in negotiation in order to award the building contracts for the two converter  station and the installation of the cable in the tunnel, and the construction would start at the end of 2015 and start  to be operational in 2018.

texts.speaker: Jacques Gounon
texts.text: Rail freight is working well and ElecLink is now ready to construction, which is a very exciting new piece of  infrastructure that we are considering and we'll comment this later on.

texts.speaker: Jacques Gounon
texts.text: In [indiscernible] (16:31) also a very nice place. So we consider that effectively we had an undirect consequence of  the Paris attack, but all in all, it's quite limited.

texts.text: So 48, we are still targeting Vision 2020 goals with 2 million trucks, 3 million cars, 13.5 million high -speed  passengers working closely with our team and the specific working groups which are mentioned.

texts.speaker: Jacques Gounon
texts.text: I will make some comment. Oil price is not an issue for us because, even if it is a good news for the maritime  operator, they have [ph] so huge bulk of list (28:40) to cover that they don't intend to -- from our best knowledge,  to don't intend to change their pricing policy.

texts.speaker: Jacques Gounon
texts.text: And I would say the same for the oil when you are [indiscernible] (28:52) when the oil is up, price is up; and when  the oil is down, you [ph] compare here the oil just – or less (29:02) at the cost which decreased, so we hav e no fear  about that.

texts.speaker: Jacques Gounon
texts.text: And I would say that, if oil is down, it gives some possibility for British tourist of course to consider new travel. So  it's neutral and I don't see any negative impact of the oil downsizing price.

file: GETI.B - Acquisition of Atrium Medical Inc by Getinge AB Call 3October2011 700 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Oct-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Johan Malmquist
texts.profession: President, CEO & Investor Relations Officer, Getinge AB
texts.text: The next product area, Cardiothoracic Drainage, this is really where Atrium started out 30 years ago with pretty  much nothing. Today, they do close to a million drainage products. They cover the full spectrum from dry  products to wet products. They cover all the way from pediatrics to adults. And they also have a very attractive  pipeline. Next year, they expect to launch the eDrain, which is a product that will come with enhanced clinical  features which will hopefully allow physicians to extract diagnostic data that can hopefully shorten the amount of  time that a patient needs to remain on a drainage product and hopefully, also, prevent that the drainage product is  removed before it should in the patient.

file: GETI.B - Capital Markets Day 21November2018 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 22-Nov-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: There's also a demographic challenge that I think is worth highlighting. So if you look at where we are now  between now and 2025, we will add another billion of people to the planet. Almost one-third of those will be 65  years and older. And this comes with the lifestyle-related diseases. We live longer but are little bit sicker and so  on and have higher demands on treatment. So it's another area that has a big impact on how we strategize and  how we tailor our offer to meet these needs.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: Another opportunity that hasn't got much attention, by the way, we've had another more structured look at lately  has to do with sustainability. We performed the materiality analysis during this year. It is a theme that is gaining  more attention in many different ways, and it's not something that we do just to be a good corporate citizen or do  our part to help the planet. It is also about the way customers select their partners. This is getting much more  attention from our customers when they choose who to partner with in our industry.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: It is also becoming more important in the war for talent. Most people, when you look at joining new companies,  well, they factor this in as well. They want to work in companies that have a sustainable approach to what they do.  And it's been really encouraging to work with the organization during this year when it comes to sustainability.  There's a great reception and willingness to address this and really turn it into a viable sustainable business for us  as well.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: So we've chosen 4 out of the 17 United Nations Sustainable Development Goals to focus on. These are the four  that we believe are most relevant for us as a company and where we can have the biggest impact. And we've  also committed to reporting in line with the global accepted ways of following up this.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: So significant gap compared to a relative – relevant peer basket here. And I want to drill down on this from a cost  perspective, so if you disregard price and mix and those kind of effects [ph] and all (00:23:00), we can see that  just in the cost structure, the part that make up COGS in our P&L, there are number of things that are lower- hanging fruits, if we call them that, that has to do with purchasing, that has to do with logistics, warehousing and  so on, that we've already started addressing and can see the first green shoots of improvement.

texts.speaker: Johan Malmquist
texts.profession: President, CEO & Investor Relations Officer, Getinge AB
texts.text: On the activity side, quite little to report. We launched a new sterilizer, improved process data, improved  performance and it's specifically designed for the treatment of temperature-sensitive devices and instruments.

file: GETI.B - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 11July2012 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-Jul-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Johan Malmquist
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: We've also made two product acquisitions in this quarter. We acquired from Avalon Laboratories a novel cannula  that will complement our ECMO offering very well. We have approximately 35% of the global market for ECMO  where our new product, the Cardiohelp, has played an essential role. And this product, which is the so-called [ph]  venous-venous (9:02) cannula, allows to exchange oxygen and remove carbon dioxide from the blood by relatively  small incision in a single cannula in the jugular of the patient. The second product acquisition we have made is  from a Swedish company called Dipylon, and they have a product called Eirus which is used for continuous blood  glucose monitoring. And just as a short, sort of, information to control the blood glucose levels in critically ill  patients within certain band – within a certain bandwidth is very important to recovery, and significant swings of  the blood glucose levels in patients can cause severe complications. And the product actually exists and is used in  clinical trials today, but we believe we have a bit of work to do to sort of package it better. And we believe that we  will have a product that we can distribute and sell and see a marked product by the end of the coming year. And –  I mean if we do a good job and if the product comes out, as we hope at least, then we think that this could open up  a market in excess of SEK500 million within this. And it is a rather unique technology in its ability to give a  continuous lead, which none of the competing product does at this point in time.

texts.speaker: Johan Malmquist
texts.profession: President, CEO, Director & Head-Investor Relations, Getinge AB
texts.text: On the highlights side, we have three items. The first one is around the efficiency improvement program within  Infection Control. I've already said, we continued to make progress. In the quarter, we initiated negotiations with  unions in Sweden with the aim of transferring the production of flusher disinfectors that are currently  manufactured at our plant in Växjö. Those products, subject to negotiations, will be moved to our facility Poznan  in Poland. We also concluded the union negotiations that were opened up in the last quarter when it comes to  transferring our production in Mansfield, UK, to our Swedish facility in Getinge. This change will mean that all life  science sterilizers will be concentrated to a single manufacturing location go ing forward.

file: GETI.B - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 15July2015 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Alexander Walter Myers
texts.text: So, we've initiated here a cost containment program for the rest of the year, and focus is I would say very high on  our supply chain strategy and program. And there again, I want to highlight, we announced the Rochester closure,  our intention to close the Rochester plant and move production to Poznan, where 80 employees will be affected  and the project will be completed or the transfer is expected to be completed by the fourth quarter.

And we're  also introducing the VOLISTA, which is a more advanced lighting system, focusing on both the top and the mid  tier.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: We can then move over to page number 12 and we'll talk a little bit about the performance in our efficiency  enhancement program also called Big 5. texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB

texts.speaker: Karl Joacim Claesson Lindoff
texts.profession: Acting President & Chief Executive Officer, Getinge AB
texts.text: All in all, the Big 5 efficiency enhancement program has continued with high speed in the whole organization  during the fourth quarter. We see plan progress in our lean sales and admin process and also very  nice progress in our actions around direct sourcing where we have overachieved with regards to the targets that  we had for the full year.

file: GETI.B - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 29January2018 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Jan-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: We also launched an upgraded version of the Cart Washer Disinfector Getinge 9100E in the fourth quarter, and  this – among other things, it's a product that now uses less water and less energy and therefore, provides  additional benefit to our customers. We also had a big milestone. We've now installed over 1,000 hybrid operating  rooms and this milestone was achieved in November. It's really a good evidence of our strong position in this part  of the business.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Director, Getinge AB
texts.text: And, of course, we cannot forget to mention the distribution of Arjo as well, which we completed ahead of  scheduled time and I really feel that we have two standalone companies now that are clearly focused on their own  strategies and the atmosphere inside Getinge is really positive here. We have very good energy in the company  now for 2018 and onwards. So, it's another key activity during the fourth quarter.

texts.speaker: Mattias Sven Perjos
