GF - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 19July2010 100 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 19-Jul-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Slide number seven. This is to show where we are regarding cost reductions. Remember that we in – we  communicated in May 2009 our plan to reduce our cost base by CHF350 million in a sustainable way until 2012.  Well, as of 2010, we are slightly above of this [ph] feature (04:27) of CHF350 million, and we will probably reach a  reduction of cost of CHF430 million. So all the measures announced in 2009 are being practically implemented.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: You can see your right, the picture which shows that we are also active in China, in geothermal heating systems,  we provided only for the Shanghai stock all the systems for an amount of about CHF1 million.

file: GF - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 18July2011 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 18-Jul-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In this respect, the launch of new products and the development of new markets gave a further impetus to the top  line. We can see an example in the picture. These are photovoltaic cells, an expanding growth [ph] bucket (03:59)  worldwide, the production of which requires ultra pure water. The new [indiscernible] (04:07) we launched last  year have shown a great success for this type of application allowing Georg Fischer Piping Systems to add directly  and indirectly more than CHF50 million to our top line.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: And, thirdly, there is a strong rebound in those European markets which are relevant for Georg Fischer; the  German car industry including truck manufacturers is on the rise; the investments in machine tools are on a sharp  increase in almost all European countries; exports of water treatment equipment are doing well and so is the  construction activity in Switzerland.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: For a Swiss company exposed to very strong currencies, it is vital to remain more innovative than competition. In  the next three slides, 20, 21, 22, I just picked up a few examples to explain the point one per Corporate Group. At  GF Piping Systems, slide 20, ballast water treatment has become a new promising application. The International  Maritime Organization, IMO, had not long ago decided that all seagoing ships of a certain tonnage need until 2016  to treat ballast water before releasing it again in order to avoid the impact on local marine life from  microorganisms or objects from the other side of the world.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: We are the first company to offer a no- plastic solution for this application. Many ships have already been  equipped and the potential is great with 57,000 ships to be retrofitted, and even if we can capture only a portion of  this, it is certainly an interesting opportunity at an average of $20,000 to $30,000 worth of our products per ship.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: And just to show Automotive, slide 21, more and more orders are coming in for electrical parts. The example  shows a battery converter housing for a well-known brand in Europe. The point is that the expertise of Georg  Fischer in lightweight is more and more appreciated by customers as the pressure increases to reduce emission.

file: GF - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 17July2012 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 17-Jul-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Regarding our strategy 2015, we have brought its implementation one further step forward with the acquisition of  two leading companies in the US at GF Piping Systems: Harvel Plastics from Eastern Pennsylvania and IPP from  Dallas, Texas.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In America, GF Piping Systems increased its sales in all sectors, in particular, gaining market share in gas and  water distribution with GF Central Plastics the company bought four years ago. Sales in industrial applications  also went up double digits, spurred by the newly developed market segments of cooling and shipbuilding, as well  as strong sales to US semiconductor manufacturers, which continued to significantly invest.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In Europe, the first two months of the year were rather difficult on account of the harsh winter conditions, which  prevented work in infrastructure and in building technology. The second quarter was clearly better, but industrial  segments such as solar panels production continued to suffer.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In Asia, water infrastructure remained strong, whereas activities in the semiconductor sector and at chemical  plants were clearly subdued. In addition, the construction business in China remained depressed, especially in the  first quarter. The profitability of GF Piping Systems remains at the double-digit level, but the lower plant load in  Switzerland had its effect. Also, the acquisitions' related amortizations shaved 60 basis points off the return on  sales.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The new acquisitions, Harvel Plastics and IPP, are running well; will add $130 million of annual turnover and  certainly will add additional momentum to GF Piping Systems in the North American continent. Those very much  complement the product portfolio of GF Piping Systems with little overlap. Positive synergies can therefore

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: GF Automotive has made full use of its in-built working time flexibility and thus adjusted both the number of  temporary workers and the level of overtime done by several plants, while energy prices and wages went up  significantly in Germany and Austria and compensated to achieve cost reductions.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Why so? Our three Corporate Groups are well positioned to profit from growth opportunities in Asia and America.  For example, our key Automotive customers in China are those which tend to gain market share. Also, home sales  in China are being revived after the slump over the last 12 months. New phone, new tablet mobiles are coming up,  a sector in which GF AgieCharmilles has a good foothold. Furthermore, our new plants in China, but also in  Malaysia allow us to quickly address the promising demand for water infrastructure in China or for residential  housing in Southeast Asia.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In the US, the newly acquired companies will now contribute more to both top and bottom lines. In Europe, we  also see some bright spots like the construction business in the north especially in Germany. There is also an  upside potential at GF Piping Systems as pipe installations, which could not proceed during the cold winter, have  been shifted to the rest of the year.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: New product launches are taking place at the three corporate groups, which would also add to the positive  momentum of the second quarter. For example, truck manufacturers start to produce according to the new Euro 6  emission norms, which entail the manufacturer of new parts. In addition, cost reduction measures have been  taken both at GF Automotive and GF Piping Systems, which will have the full effect in the second half year.

file: GF - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 17July2013 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 17-Jul-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Turning now to the three divisions of Georg Fischer and starting slide seven with GF Piping Systems. The  unusually long and cold winter conditions did affect construction and infrastructure, especial ly in Europe and  parts of the U.S.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Turning now to GF Automotive, slide eight. GF Automotive sold last November two aluminum sand-casting plants  with a combined annual turnover of CHF 130 million. If we exclude this divestment from the figures, one ends up  in the first half of 2013 with a similar turnover as in the same period of 2012. Higher production levels in China  certainly helped to maintain the overall sales figure of GF Automotive at previous year's level.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The common denominator behind being the ability of GF Automotive to offer its customers solutions to reduce the  weight of their vehicles in a significant manner, 20% to 50%, either through the use of new materials or thanks to  the application of new designs as shown on this slide for a well-known European car manufacturer.

texts.speaker: Roland Abt
texts.profession: CFO, Head-Corporate Finance & Controlling, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Sales, overall, came in a little bit lower than previous year. The difference is CHF 30 million or 2%. The net effect  from acquisitions and divestments amounts to minus CHF 50 million, mainly due to the divestment of the two  aluminum sand-casting foundries in Friedrichshafen and Garching.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Projects, delayed by bad weather during the first half year, are now coming up at GF Piping Systems. At GF  Automotive, we see a slight increase of truck production in Europe during the second half year and also increases  in China. Together, these effects would at least partly compensate the downturn in the European car mark et.

file: GF - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 17July2014 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 17-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The operating results rose 12% to CHF 132 million as plants were better loaded and the cost reductions of 2013  became fully effective. In fact, without currency effect, the increase would have exceeded 20%. Moreover, a key  strategic milestone has been reached. For the first time, GF Piping Systems became the largest division in our  corporation. This represents an important change in our portfolio, falling in line with our strategy to reduce  electricity and increase profitability, overall.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: On slide 4, you can see that the share of GF Piping Systems in the total turnover of GF has been steadily increasing  over the past years. Our objective to lift GF Piping Systems until 2015 to 40% to 45% of the GF turnover is being  reached. Already in the first semester of 2014, GF Piping Systems accounted for cir ca 40% against 38% for GF  Automotive.

file: GF - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 21July2015 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 21-Jul-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: Unexpected raw material shortages slowed down the rate of utility pipe installations in Europe. On the other  hand, industrial applications gained in strength, demand for gas distribution in the U.S. continued to be strong  and large orders were booked in the ship-building business. The operating result stood at CHF 63 million.  Considering the Swiss franc related one-offs of CHF 6 million, the operating result reached CHF 69 million,  [indiscernible] (05:06) at the level of mid-2014 with CHF 70 million. The Swiss franc overall effect was quiet high,  since GF Piping Systems exports from Switzerland go to a large extent into the Eurozone.

file: GF - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 20July2016 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 20-Jul-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: An interesting example of a chemical process is a battery featured on the slide and designed for the storage of a  large amount of power, certainly one of the solutions to use more clean energy sources. The first set of batteries  have been installed in Japan in the last few years. Utility and building technology applications also achieved a  steady growth in those geographical, areas except in the U.S., where shale gas related investment drastically  decreased.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: Division increased again its operating result to CHF 54 million, up 8%. Thanks to a high load at its light metal  plants as the use of aluminum and magnesium is spreading, especially for structural components. In this respect,  electric car-related orders are gaining traction. Like for the Model X of Tesla you see on the picture, but also  battery covers and structural components for a number of new models of several car manufacturers.

file: GF - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 19July2017 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 19-Jul-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Turning now to all three divisions, starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 5, the division increased its turnover by  10% to CHF 826 million. Its sales in industrial applications, meaning in chemical processes, water treatment,  semiconductor plants continued to grow steadily in almost all geographies. Utility sales picked up, in particular,  gas distribution in the U.S. and in China, where investments in cleaner energies are being pushed by the  government, especially near Beijing. On the slide, you can see an example of a typical gas network installation  showing the workers in China welding our polyethylene pipes and fittings using GF welding machines.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Sales in the Building Technology sector also registered a high growth, thanks to new products like the COOL-FIT  range launched end of last year, as well as large orders in the shipbuilding sector division substantially increased  its operating profit by 17% to CHF 97 million. This is a result of a good load at most production plants worldwide,  but the recent acquisitions of 2016 also have positively contributed to this increase.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: We announced yesterday, slide 6, a new acquisition in Canada this time, a company, Urecon, based in Québec  and Alberta, is a specialist of pre-insulated piping systems for freeze control, an example of which, you see on the  right side of the slide. While purchasing this company on one hand because Canada has been the wide spot for  GF Piping Systems and freeze protection is an interesting niche, but also as a way to accelerate the introduction  in North America, of a COOL-FIT pre-insulated piping systems for air-conditioning and cooling applications.

file: GF - Q2 2018 Earnings Call 18July2018 400 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 18-Jul-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The picture of the slide shows some of the very specialized piping systems we deliver for wafer fabs. That growth  in utility and building technology was also sustained, especially in the U.S. and in China for gas distribution and in  Europe for building applications. GF Piping Systems increased again its operating profit by 19% to CHF 115  million, thanks to the additional load at most plants, but also thanks to its focus on high value products and  businesses, which bore fruits, and in addition, the recent acquisitions of 2016-2017 were accretive to earnings.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The division, slide 7, is also launching several promising digital products such as a new thermal water sterilization  system for hospitals to prevent legionella and digital valves for its industrial applications. The aim is to facilitate  online monitoring and calibration as well as easily customized processes at our customer sites.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The division benefited from a good demand in the truck sector, but also from a growing demand for its light-weight  components made of aluminum and magnesium, an example of which is a picture door sill frame.

file: GF - Q4 2010 Earnings Call 1March2011 645 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 01-Mar-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Also new products added momentum and I'll come back to it. You'll see that first in Asia, maybe it's an interesting  topic. We added in 2010 a new way to sell our products. Now in China, when someone buys an apartment, you buy  the apartment nude; in other words, with nothing in it, right? Yes, there is metal and concrete, but you have to  organize everything, including the heating. And so, he has to go in store and telling, "Look, I would like to have  these kind of products, please can you install and how much will it cost?"

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: But also in Switzerland, we developed – I mean, those of you who were in September at our Technology Day, saw  this product. It's a new diaphragm valve which allows customers to greatly reduce the so-called pressure drop in  pipes, which means for the same dimension of pipe, you have a double flow rate, which means that customers can  have smaller pipes, and, therefore, less cost and smaller valves and have the same flow of water or chemical. And  thanks to these new products, we could increase the sales of this type of elements by 50% last year. By the way,  they are produced in a Seewis [indiscernible] (09:12).

texts.speaker: Roland Abt
texts.profession: CFO, Head-Corporate Finance & Controlling, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: So if you take these bars here, this corresponds exactly to personnel cost and operating expenses, the figures you  can find in the income statement. And then you see, of course, different elements we had last year still a big part of  non-sustainable cost savings here. They have completely disappeared here. We had a negative volume effect again  and so on. Finally, a positive foreign exchange effect leading to this figure here, but including the sustainable cost  savings of all together CHF350 million.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: We will alter our portfolio for the benefit the Georg Fischer Piping Systems, which will by 2015, account for more  than 40% of the global turnover of Georg Fischer. That means 40% or around 40% for Georg Fischer Automotive  and around 20% for Georg Fischer AgieCharmilles. This new mix should increase the average profitability of our  corporation.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: We are conscious that these goals are ambitious. But they are not completely farfetched and if you look at the  present profitability in the past five years of Piping Systems, we are more or less at 11% in average. So a goal of 11%  to 13%, okay, seems ambitious but not farfetched. And at Georg Fischer AgieCharmilles and Georg Fischer  Automotive, we already reached 7% to 8% at least two, three years in the recent past in 2006, for example, 2000,  2007. So, yes, it's ambitious because we have not yet attained a four, five, six years in a row this kind of figures.  We have not achieved this kind of figures but it is not completely out of the sky.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Now, in order to reach this goals, what do we intend to do? We will focus ourselves on performance in the three  groups, and on cyclicality reduction. First of all, performance. What do we mean by this? We mean that we will  maintain a low cost base in Europe, stressing product competitiveness, improving efficiency in our plants and in  our services, and we foster innovation in the three groups in order to keep the technological leadership in those  markets where we are present, electroerosión at AgieCharmilles, for example, in the iron foundries, automotives,  the transport of gas and water at Piping Systems. And to reduce cyclicity, we will rebalance our portfolio in favor  of the less cyclical activities, more service activities at AgieCharmilles, for example. We also increased the, as we  said, the Piping Systems turnover through investments in new plants but also through acquisitions.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Now this is at Piping Systems on solutions to conserve water and to conserve energy. At Georg Fischer  Automotive, we focus on reducing the weight of the parts as answer to reducing the emissions of CO2 and the  consumption of petrol. At AgieCharmilles, we'll concentrate ourselves on offering high-precision manufacturing  solutions. We don't want to be in all machine tools. We want to be in those machine tools, which have a high  precision because we see the trends towards miniaturization in all the parts of the devices that we use every day.  This device, for example, has 2,500 parts. Extremely small. That's exactly where the specialty of AgieCharmilles  lies. So, these are the trends that we want to follow and to concentrate ourselves on part of our innovation.

file: GF - Q4 2012 Earnings Call 26February2013 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 26-Feb-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Now, looking at the three divisions a bit more in details and starting with GF Piping Systems, slide six, GF Piping  Systems grew 11% to almost CHF 1.3 billion on the back of the two acquisitions made in the U.S.; Harvel Plastics  and IPP in Texas. GF Piping Systems has been also affected by the slowdown in several European markets,  especially in the south of Europe, but also by clear demand shortfall in some industrial sectors like, for example, in  semiconductors or in the photovoltaic industry.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: This was compensated by a strong organic growth in Asia and America. In Asia, despite a slow start in China,  turnover went up, especially in the second half year. And in America, organic growth came mainly from much- needed renovations in water and gas infrastructure, but also from a steady pickup in the construction industry.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Slide seven describes those two acquisitions in general. They were done to reinforce our position in the U.S. and in  North America in industrial piping systems and in the promising water infrastructure business, at slide seven.  Why so, because higher and higher volumes of waters need to be transported either for power plants or for the so- called coal seam bed installations or the, what, the shipper gas, right, the shale gas, right, installations, shale gas  installation. And as illustrated by the picture, IPP is a specialist of very big fittings and pipes in polyethylene,  exactly what is required to meet this new water infrastructure needs.  But the development of new market segments also helped in 2012 to increase sales. Slide eight shows very  promising mining and seam gas applications, for which large orders have been booked in 2012, especially in  Australia, for example, but also hygiene solutions, as you can see, for hospitals, whereby our specially-designed  piping systems eliminate dead spaces in between pipes fitting and valves and, therefore, prevent the development  of bacteria in between those components. It's called LegioTherm and Legio stop, to stop Legionella, quite a big  topic in Germany, for example, last year.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Furthermore, two non-core aluminum sand casting plants in Germany have been sold, the combined workforce  about 450. On the other hand, significant new contracts were obtained, thanks to material and design innovations,  and you can see the wheel carrier, which is shown in the picture, reduce the weights by about 20% compared to  competition or compared to previous generation and is now already sold this year at the pace of 8 million piece  per year.

texts.speaker: Roland Abt
texts.profession: CFO, Head-Corporate Finance & Controlling, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In addition, then we have made two acquisitions in 2012. Harvel Plastics, we acquired at the beginning of the year  is already included for 12 months. And the second acquisition we made in May is included in the figures of 2012  for seven months.

texts.speaker: Roland Abt
texts.profession: CFO, Head-Corporate Finance & Controlling, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Net result from continued operations sum up to CHF 155 million. The loss from discontinued operations, what I  already mentioned is divestment of the two aluminum sand casting foundries, amounts to CHF 28 million. So, net  profit is at CHF 127 million, a reduction of 24%.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: Thank you, Roland. I think we didn't give much information about the outlook this year. So, I'll give you now a bit
texts.text: To achieve these numbers, we will, first of all, increase, as already mentioned, the share of GF Piping Systems in  the total turnover. Our GF Automotive will further optimize productivity in Europe, first of all, through additional  cost reduction already this year of CHF25 million and increased margins through the introduction of new parts for  the incoming generation of trucks and cars. We will also increase our turnover in China by 40% until 2015,  bringing its share of total close to 20% at GF Automotive on 11% today.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: Thank you, Roland. I think we didn't give much information about the outlook this year. So, I'll give you now a bit
texts.text: Finally, a few words about the key trends in our main markets, to show you how GF is positioned or positioning  itself in order to profit from those trends. In the Piping Systems business, slide 27, the growing demand for water  is a key driver. As you can see on the left chart, water the demand is on the rise everywhere and especially in Asia,  that's the black curve. Water infrastructure has either to be developed where it does not exist, or renovated, for  example, in Europe or in the U.S. to keep up with demand and that includes treatment, water, transport, that  includes water recycling in industrial application, but also for building and homes, for irrigation and for mining.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: Thank you, Roland. I think we didn't give much information about the outlook this year. So, I'll give you now a bit
texts.text: And this is where GF Piping Systems can contribute and is well positioned worldwide through its expertise,  involves a network which do not leak and do not contaminate the end run. We, therefore, continue to enlarge our  footprint, investing on our own, for example, in China, we're also looking for complementary acquisitions, where  we still have white spots.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: Thank you, Roland. I think we didn't give much information about the outlook this year. So, I'll give you now a bit
texts.text: Our GF Automotives, slide 28, the key driver is a reduction of CO2 emissions everywhere, not only in Europe. In  Europe, for example, as you can see on the chart, regulations call for a reduction to 95 grams per kilometer until  2020 from about 130 grams per kilometer today in average per fleet. This is where GF Automotive differentiates  itself from competition by offering its customers solutions, new materials and new designs to reduce the weight of  part by 20% to 50%.

file: GF - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 25February2014 915 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Feb-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: All three divisions also contributed to the increase in operating results on account of better plant loads overall.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In line with our strategy, slide six, we progressed once more towards a better balanced portfolio. Thanks to the  latest transactions which took place end of 2012 with the divestment of the aluminum sand casting activities of GF  Automotive and thanks to the acquisitions made by GF Piping Systems in the U.S. in 2012 and in Turkey in 2013.  This trend will continue in 2014 on account of the latest divestment of GF Automotive that means that GF Piping  Systems has a good chance already in 2014 to become the largest division of GF or at least to approach i t.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Slide eight shows two examples of those industrial applications which did well last year. The first picture on the  left shows a new water park in Sydney, the largest of its kind in the world and for which GF delivered mo st of the  pipes, fittings, valves and water sensors as a package.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The second picture shows a wafer manufacturing plant for which GF Piping Systems delivers all the piping  systems for water and chemicals, including the highly specialized ones used to supply the ultra-pure water for the  manufacturing process of those wafers.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In January 2014, the gravity die-casting activity of GF Automotive has been divested, slide 11. This completes the  portfolio streamlining at GF Automotive and allows the division to concentrate itself on its core iron casting as  well as aluminum and magnesium pressure die-casting activities. The two examples shown on the slide illustrates  what drives this market today that is to reduce component weight in a significant way in order to bring down CO2  emissions and gas consumption. And this is precisely what we focus ourselves on and what we believe is behind  the market share gains of GF Automotive.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Also slide 14, we renamed GF AgieCharmilles GF Machining Solutions to better reflect the diversity of its present  offering, the electro erosion machines of AgieCharmilles, the milling machine of Mikron, the tooling automation  system of System 3R and this change has been implemented as of 1 January of this year.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, CEO & Head-Corporate Development, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: At GF Piping Systems, slide 30, we are presently investing in Schaffhausen to pr oduce very large fittings for water  transport because we see a steady demand in that sector, in Europe, in the Middle East, in Russia, for example.  And we invest also in China. In China, we're investing in two additional plants to produce high -density  polyethylene water pipes. And we do so because we believe that the demand for water and waste water treatment  but also water transport will remain high in that country on accounts of its fight against pollution and its  tremendous water needs in the Middle Eastern part of the country.

file: GF - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 24February2015 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 25-Feb-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: On slide 3, you can see that GF Piping Systems became last year the largest division of GF, with a turnover share  of 39%. This has been one of the key objectives of our 2015 strategy, an objective which aims at reducing the  corporation's exposure to economic cycles as well as increase its overall profitability. The GF portfolio of today is  quite different from what it was 10 years or even 5 years ago.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: Let's now take a look at the three divisions of GF, starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 6, where we have shown,  as illustrated, a part of a typical building technology installation.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: The performance of GF Piping Systems, slide 7, has been upheld in 2014 despite an uneven worldwide demand.  The division has increased its turnover by 5% to CHF 1.476 billion. The shale gas boom in the U.S. has created  opportunities downstream in gas distribution, where GF Piping Systems holds a leading position in that country.

texts.speaker: Roland Abt
texts.profession: Head - Finance and Controlling (Chief Financial Officer) & Member - Executive Committee
texts.text: Trade accounts receivable has considerably increased to CHF 643 million. We had an extraordinary strong month  of December, leading to high receivables. The Piping Systems' distributors waited in November to place orders  because they expected price reduction based on the lower oil price, [ph] so there was (18:36) a shift of sales from  November to December.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: GF Piping Systems, on slide 30, recently developed geo-localization tools and services to enable customers to  easily trace the location of the components they installed. This is done as shown in the picture through a QR code  on the product packing, in this case a fitting or a valve, linked to a smartphone or a computer application. The  same can be used to record and register the welding premises of each joints across gas or water networks, but also  to link the stock of our customers to our own stock information.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: GF Automotive, slide 31, is entering the now promising electric car business. And we already produced this year  components for several electric car manufacturers worldwide, including battery housing, as shown on the picture.  Since weight reduction is even more important for electric cars, we believe that the expertise of GF Automotive in  light-metal design is and will be an advantage precisely in this sector.

file: GF - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 1March2016 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 01-Mar-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: Looking now at the three divisions, starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 8. Sales in local currencies were on par  with previous year, in Swiss francs, 4% lower at CHF 1.42 billion. The first half year was rather weak as adverse  currency developments and unfavorable weather conditions affected customer sentiments, but we saw a s trong  rebound in the second half, especially in China and worldwide in the industrial applications of GF Piping Systems.  An example of which is the cruise line sector featured on the slide in which numerous orders have been won  thanks to the collaboration of our teams in the U.S., in France, in Japan, in Sweden and in Switzerland.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: To be noted is the fact that plastic raw material prices went down significantly in 2015 by about 20% resulting a  lower pipe prices for a negative impact of about 2% on the top line. Despite the significant impacts of the Swiss  franc appreciation, the operating results increased to CHF 143 million for a 10.1% return on sales, well above the  9.6% achieved previous year.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.text: We also, slide 34, expand in new market segments such as air-conditioning with especially developed pre- insulated plastic piping sy stems for cooling fridge to replace corrosion from metal ones. Our GF Automotive, slide  35, we will enlarge scope of our activities to non-automotive sectors such as tractor and machinery parts, but we  do not exclude new applications like the aircraft industry, for example.

file: GF - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 28February2017 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Feb-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Second thrust, slide 8, has to do with a step-wise portfolio shift at all three divisions towards higher-margin  businesses. The shift is well under way as illustrated during our Technology Day last September where we  presented key innovations. With entry of GF Piping Systems in new sectors like air conditioning, the push of GF  Automotive into electric car components, and the successful development of GF Machining Solutions in the micro  laser technology as you see in the middle of the slide.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Looking now at the three divisions starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 10. GF Piping Systems had a strong  performance across the board. The division has increased its turnover by more than 5% to CHF 1.494 billion. It  enjoyed a lively demand for its industrial applications that means water treatment, chemical plants, semiconductor  plants, [ph] for example (08:34), but also a steady growth in Building Technology. An example of which is the  world's tallest residential building in Mumbai in India where most products of GF Piping Systems have been  installed. You can see this building on the slide on the right side, 450 meters high. The utility sector sales were  quite stable despite a slump in oil and gas in the U.S. and in Europe, the financial difficulties of several utilities.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The division acquired three companies in 2016, one in Indonesia in May and two in China in October, in order to  support growth in our key Asian markets. As a consequence of the higher plant load and the strong growth of  higher-margin businesses, operational profit has been increased 13% to CHF 162 million for a return on sales of  10.8% against 10.1% in 2015. The factor behind the growth in the industrial applications of GF Piping Systems,  slide 11, is certainly the steady trend towards sustainability, translating itself worldwide into more investment in  water treatment. A typical example of which you can see on the slide.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: More and more orders, slide 13, are coming in for electric and hybrid cars, certainly a fast-growing business. A  typical example of the components specific to electric cars is battery housing, which is a large and complex part  which includes cooling channels, as you can see in the picture, and for which multiple orders have been received  including one from Renault as you can see on the slide.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: On the next slide, you see the metal price effects of the division Automotive where the contractually price  reductions for raw materials have been passed through, which equal approximately [ph] CHF 40 million (17:13).  Considering that, the organic growth would have been at 3.3% and therefore, on corporate level, 3%.

file: GF - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 28February2018 800 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-Mar-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Looking now at all three divisions and starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 6. The division shows a highly  profitable growth across the board. All segments and geographies grew significantly leading to an increase of  12% to CHF 1,678 million. The division enjoyed a sustained demand worldwide for its industrial applications.  Sales in the gas utility sector were very high especially in China and in the U.S. And building technology sales  grew in almost all countries.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In the picture, you can see an example of our specialized high-value plastic fittings made of PVDF for the  transport of wafer cleaning water in semiconductor plants, a sector where investments are on the upswing,  especially in Asia.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In July 2017, GF Piping Systems acquired the company Urecon based in Montreal, Canada, a specialist of pre- insulated freeze control piping systems with the intention to also use the company as a springboard in North  America for its pre-insulated COOL-FIT cooling pipes offering. The company was already accretive to GF  earnings in 2017.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President & Chief Executive Officer, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: All three divisions are also well-positioned to profit from secular trends like water conservation for GF Piping  Systems, electric cars and vehicle weight reduction for GF Automotive, as well as the digitalization of production  for GF Machining Solutions. We expect therefore for 2018, a further growth and returns well in line with our 2020  objectives that is a top line increase of 3% to 5% and profitability figures in the 8% to 9% range for the original  sales and 18% to 22% for the return on invested capital.

file: GF - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 27February2019 700 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Feb-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Looking now at the three divisions and starting with GF Piping Systems, slide 7. Sales were up 9% to CHF 1.821  billion, organically 8%. The division enjoyed a sustained demand in its industry and utility sectors worldwide,  which grew double digits. All segments and geographies contributed to the high growth of the division, with  America growing the most. In the picture, you can see an example of a desalination plant, certainly a growing  business in countries where water is scarce and for which all products of GF Piping Systems are used, sensors,  valves, fittings, pipes and where we even preassemble [ph] skids (00:06:29) for our customers in order to speed  up project completion. The operating results, the EBIT was up 15% to CHF 217 million, as all plants were well  loaded and the highest shares of high-value products contributed to the margin increase.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: The operating result, the EBIT stood at CHF 86 million, down from CHF 93 million in 2017. The main negative  effect was the ramp-up of the new light metal plant in the U.S., which started in August – started production in  August 2018 and impacted the division's EBIT by about CHF 16 million. Also, at yearend, call-offs from several  car manufacturers went down, partly due to the newly enforced emission registration test, the so-called WLTP,  the world light-duty vehicle harmonized testing procedure.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Major steps have been taken during 2018, slide 10, to reshape the portfolio of GF Casting Solutions. We acquired  in April 2018 Precicast, the well-known specialist of precision castings for aircraft engines and industrial gas  turbines. And in December, we divested two large iron casting plants in Mettmann and Singen in Germany. This is  in line with our strategy to shift our portfolio towards higher-margin businesses. Accordingly, the profitability  objective of the division for the current 2020 strategy period has been increased by 200 basis points to an 8% to  10% range for the return on sales.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: In September 2018, slide 12, GF Machining Solutions entered into a partnership with a company, 3D Systems, in  the U.S. to offer new, integrated and automated 3D printing lines to its customers. Including the automated  change of powder chambers without operators handling, as well as dedicated wire cut EDM to efficiently and  precisely detach the 3D printing components from the support. On the picture, you can see fuel injection nozzles  for industrial gas turbines produced with these 3D printing machines. These products will be shown on the next  [indiscernible] (00:11:38) in September 2019 with sales already starting this year.

texts.speaker: Andreas Müller
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: These divested companies did not contribute to the division's EBIT. Post transaction, 56% of the turnover goes to  the light metal automotive castings for which we announced large orders last year. Aerospace, energy and  industrial applications would sum up to approximately 24%. The lion's share of the remaining 20% automotive iron  castings stands for the division Chinese operation.

texts.speaker: Yves Serra
texts.profession: President, Chief Executive Officer & Member-Executive Committee, Georg Fischer AG
texts.text: Ladies and gentlemen, let me then summarize actual positioning of GF as of 2019. In 2018 was a successful year  with results well in line with our targets, but also a year of strategic transformation. GF is not immune to  recessions, but our company has a strong and solid financial structure, has a well-balanced global presence and  is well-positioned in markets with circular growth, characteristics and driven by sustainability requirement towards  the sector for GF Piping Systems, cars and aircraft engine efficiency at GF Casting Solutions as well as the  miniaturization of components and product automation at GF Machining Solutions.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: We are present in sectors that have been favored by the present situation. We don't have any major investments  underway. So overall, the transactions that have taken place demonstrate that we typically respond to the existing  demand. Over the longer term of course, we'll have to be thinking about the evolutions of the market for the Paris  region. But if you look at the historical average, I believe that the situation is not worrying. We will however, need  to verify any risk concentration for future developments. And this is what I will be explaining when I get back to  our investment strategy.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: On the issue of arbitration, we have increased our assets sales €1.2 billion. As I explained earlier, our program is  well underway. We've signed €420 million of sales plus €352 million, the promised sales to which we need to add  the extra €200 million of logistics portfolio, which is being concluded – that is over €900 million secured. So I  think it's fair to say that we will reach the objective of €1.2 billion at the end of this year. Over the medium-term,  we wish to continue along the lines the €200 million to €300 million of unit-by-unit residential sales. This is  something we can manage. We will of course take into account the decisions of the public authorities in order to  continue to the satisfaction of the buyers and of our tenants and we will continue this unit-by-unit residential sales  program.  In terms of office space and healthcare, we have rotation on very mature assets, which have a risk in terms of –  those which have a risk in terms of rents or the environment on what we are selling because the investments we  would be too high as compared to our objectives. This rotation represents about 2.5% to 5% of JV over the coming  period and we also have the Beaugrenelle building which will be sold as soon as we have opened the shopping  center next year. In terms of hotels, we have good profitability for these assets. There is no particular problem  here. We will act to as necessary and in terms of assets in Spain, we still have offices in Madrid and 49% of  participation that we will also be selling as soon as an opportunity turns up.

texts.speaker: Gilles Bonnier
texts.text: During the first half year, we have restructured almost €1.5 billion hedging. We have cancelled for 2.7 years  maturity that we've cancelled and we have also – have for – seven year bond, an amount of €650 million that is  fixed rate debt. So you have on the left hand side, a graph showing what would be the situation that is before 2010.  And you have on the right hand side, the situation today, it means that we would have improved from 120% to  150%, and today it's a 100%. And you can see the second consequence is from 2016, we will increase our hedging  and that is more securing. And the last major change is the green boxes that you can see that is the optional part,  which makes it possible to take advantage of the Euribor short rates, which are at a historical low.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Now, our ambition is to do better, faster, and stronger – more strongly. That's not just a Daft Punk song; it's an  ambition for Gecina whose absolute priority, which hasn't changed, is to remain the leader in Europe in office  base in urban environments on the Paris market. You can tell me that the question has been raised a number of  times: European, Paris, what do we mean by that?

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Now, extracting value from our portfolio through an ambitious pipeline, we'll talk about this later. We have a  pipeline worth €3.7 billion and continue to promote innovation and sustainable development along with  environmental and community responsibility through the assets that we create and develop. And the latest  generation of office space [indiscernible] (06:08) we would like to accelerate or have three acceleration drivers –  that's a little complicated to have slides in English to present in French, but it doesn't matter. Forgive me; I'm a  little mixing them up at the moment. Forgive me for that.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: The idea of this operation is, of course, to return to the shareholders, but will retain the shares to be able to use  them as appropriate in investments that we might want to undertake. I want to explain in more detail. In a world  that is changing, the new words, modes of working and ways of using locations, there are investments that have  been dull. And we could say having a portfolio that we manage outside is rather complex. Environmental laws  being what they are; the energy transition law being rather complex; an internal team is complicated; delegation,  we didn't know where we're going.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Second point is to improve the profitability of our diversification portfolio. We are putting on the table again, for  thinking, I have no solutions to propose today because there's quite a lot work to be done. But I wanted to say, as  we presented yesterday to the board of directors, I wanted to show you that we were looking at our residential  portfolio. Gecina has the last global portfolio in residential sectors in certain levels worth €2.4 billion but, above all,  it has internal expertise with staff who know how to manage this portfolio. That's something that no longer exists  in such a consistent way on the Paris market.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: We wish to improve our results in terms of pre-letting. The Paris market, as I said before, makes it possible for us  to think about this and to have reasons for believing that this is quickly possible. Very good transactions or  preliminary transactions make it possible to increase the value creation recognition. You've seen, in fact, some of  the assets that have been presold in recent months. We can already tell you that there is a visible impact on our  results.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Furthermore, as you know, Gecina is one of the top leaders and one of the pioneers in innovation for CSR, for  environmental decisions, and for the quality of innovation in our office space. We want to accelerate the pace of  the implementation of this vision to make the offices some of the most developed ones around. This should also  make it possible for us to be able to seize new opportunity, growth opportunities without deteriorating the financial  geographic investments and financial criteria.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Through acquisitions and disposals, and developments, we have managed to continue to create value by  planning broadly ahead of market trends. As you can see, disposals in green, that you can see that are green on  our graph there, and also, asset revaluation of recent assets that are currently deployed, that you can see in  orange, all of which amounting to approximately €580 million in 2016.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: We can also discuss the principles or the main themes achieved in our objectives. 77% of our assets have been  certified at the end of 2016. This is very important because these extra financial indices are increasingly  important, and we're able to look at the trend in terms of energy consumption in our office space in kilowatt hours,  per square meters per year at 8% per year and index that we will continue to monitor. We're at minus 39%  compared to what we were doing in our assets in 2008.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Another building called – I'm looking for the name. SEPTEN was delivered, wasn't it? Not yet. So, this is part of  the 12% located in Lyon. Over the medium term, it is all located in the Paris central business district, 100% of it.  And the controlled and likely projects will be located in Paris except for a few greenfield projects, which you have  been informed of.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Finally, something which is of importance, which is part of our DNA, these are the non-financial indicators with  respect to innovation and corporate social and environmental responsibility. We consider that innovation drives  pricing power with respect to rental management and an ability to improve our rental income and margins.  Innovation with respect to comfort, environmental quality, modularity, quality of living spaces to achieve greater  efficiencies and productivity for our tenants. We shared value with our tenants. Now, these productivity  efficiencies via the WELL, WiredScore, Biodiversity certification labels are of critically importance for us.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: And this is how we have increased value through a greater number of our assets being certified and through  savings in energy consumptions in our assets, making it possible to ensure major cost savings and which have  enabled via the various certification labels to have our tenants enjoy a comfortable, pleasant and efficient leasing  spaces. And we believe this intangible value creation offering is a plus in the market.

texts.text: But we also are focused, as you know that, this is part of our DNA for many, many years, on the ESG priorities,  which are for us around four main topics, low carbon, circular economy, biodiversity and well-being.

texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA

texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: We put in place two sustainably performance-linked loans with ING and Credit Agricole not only linked to our  rating with the agencies but also linked to our rating on the sustainability with GRESB. But also we have – we are  experimenting a very large and ambitious redevelopment and restructuring of 75 Grande Armée, Live, the new  name, which is going to be a very strong and very outstanding redevelopment around reuse, recycle, and reduce  energy impact and carbon impact in the coming period.

texts.speaker: Méka Brunel
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: Within our portfolio, the breakdown of the 4.5% is 10% in CBD and [indiscernible] (00:16:44) 6 and 7, 2% in other  areas in Paris, flat in La Défense and Western Crescent, in other areas minus 11% but mostly due to one or two  buildings which are problematic, not that important. texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Gecina SA
texts.text: If we compare to what has been sold in the market, you see that in the Paris CBD the investment market average  price per square meters has represented €17,440 per square meters. It's not due to the fact that our  assets are not as good as the others are. But the reality is that the valuers take into account a sustainable  [indiscernible] (00:19:58) discounted cash flow they have a longer term view compared to what is the spot sale  price in the market. And this is a discipline we would like to keep. But this also shows the importance of  differentiation we have with the market value if we put the assets in the market tomorrow.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Looking at page four, just to run through the financials highlights very quickly, turnover very flat,  relative to the pervious year, 979 million versus 990 million and the discount due to the bad weather  that we had at the beginning of the year, we would feel comfortably probably would have  outperformed the previous years turnover.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Working capital, we continue to reduce our working capital investment and generating cash from  that. So very strong cash conversion from our operating profit into cash flow. And obviously looking  after a lots and lots of the smaller, more important customers of Grafton get with all of the large  house builders and have been suffering in the current climate.

file: GFTUL - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 31August2011 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 01-Sep-11.pdf
GFTUL - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 29August2012 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 29-Aug-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: If you just look there at the UK merchanting revenues, growth by 4% there, but obviously counteracted by a  DIY business as we go forward, the second half of the year in terms of DIY is a lot less weather-dependent than the  first half of the year. On the DIY business, they have a tough time in terms of weather in April, May and June.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: And then some of our specialist businesses, again, we talked during the self-help earlier this year about  consolidating some of our smaller businesses which we have now done. So we have three drylining and insulation  businesses that have now been consolidated into one which is now called NDI, Nationwide Drylining and  Insulation. And also the specialist construction products and bathroom products businesses have been  consolidated from three businesses down to one. So the self-help really is still focusing on maintaining and  improving margins where possible, disciplined control of costs and making sure that we're driving operational  efficiency through the business wherever that's practical.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: If you move onto the slide that's headed slide number six, UK merchanting. I think the market background you  guys probably understand as well as we do, but I think it's worth making some comments on the right-hand side  of that page where we've got trading. The merchanting market in the UK continues to decline along with overall  construction output in the UK being down. But we have seen a growth in constant currency terms, in like for like  turnover within our coal merchanting businesses in the UK, which leads us to believe that we are still taking  market share. And if you look at the comment we've put there about trading ahead of the market, what I would say  is we have been particularly strong in terms of plumbing and heating against the plumbing and heating market  and also particularly strong in insulation and drylining. But overall, our merchant business in the UK has traded  ahead of the market.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: A little bit more detail on the retailing sector, which is slide number eight. You see very clearly the downturn in  revenue which is also been impacted by a downturn in footfall. What I would say is of all our businesses, the DIY  retail business is the most weather-affected business that we have within the group. An incredibly heavy rainfall in  April and June certainly impacted the sales of gardening and leisure products in the Woodie's and Atlantic DIY  chains. As we move into the second half, the second half is much less weather-dependent than the first half of the  year.

file: GFTUL - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 28August2013 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Aug-13.pdf
GFTUL - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 27August2014 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 27-Aug-14.pdf

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: So, now turning to a little bit more of the detail. This slide looks at the quarterly like-for-like revenue growth  across the business. And what we've also included in here is the like-for-like growth for last year as well by way of  comparison. If we look at the UK first, we saw a very strong growth in the UK in the first quarter. That was against  some weak weather-related comparables in the first quarter of 2013. And then what we saw was that the growth  moderated in the UK as we went through towards the summer months.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In terms of greenfield developments, we opened a new Selco branch in Isleworth last week. So, literally, this is its  first full week of trading. And we've also got plans now to open maybe three or four Selco branches during 2015.  So, we continue to use the Selco brand as our strategic brand in the South East in particular, and developing the  specific offer that Selco has that we believe is still quite unique in the trade marketplace.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: But we do believe now that from an economic point of view, the UK is on a stable footing and it's in a position  where the growth is sustainable for the medium to long term, which is great in terms of our UK Merchant  business. And I think that, coupled with the internal growth initiatives that we have, in terms of the implants, in  terms of the new greenfield branches with Selco, in terms of the new format with Plumbase Industrial, coupled  with taking advantage of acquisition opportunities, puts us in a really good place to keep the UK growth sustained  going forward.

file: GFTUL - Q2 2015 Earnings Call 27August2015 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Aug-15.pdf

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold, FCMA, FCT
texts.text: In Manufacturing, the pace of revenue growth moderated to 14% in the first half of this year. We made further  pricing and gross margin gains in the first six months. And in July, we made a small acquisition of a bagged  product business into which we had been supplying raw material. We have an existing bagging plant based at  Bilston in the West Midlands which produces paper bag products. But this acquisition brings a modern plant  providing weatherproof packaging, which gives us further opportunities to increase capacity and market share.

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold, FCMA, FCT
texts.text: Our development activities and by that, I mean our process of implants, greenfield Selcos, bolt-on acquisitions,  are giving us a good platform for growth and providing excellent value into the Group going forward. And we will  continue to have a disciplined approach in terms of gross margin management and also cost management, making  sure that we can maximize the operating margins going forward.

file: GFTUL - Q2 2016 Earnings Call 31August2016 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Aug-16.pdf

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold, FCMA, FCT
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In Ireland MFP, our plastic pipes business, performed strongly, winning new contracts adopting work in relation to  wind farm activity. And finally, I just wanted to finish my section just turning our attention to the strengths of the  group's balance sheet and our strong cash flow conversion. Net debt of £95.7 million represents balance sheet  gearing of 9% or a ratio of net debt to EBITDA of 0.6 times.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: And we do see the Dutch market is giving us opportunities to invest going forward both in terms of organic  development and acquisition potential because it's still a relatively fragmented market. And we will open our – we  have opened now our first greenfield site in the Isero business, opening a large branch in North Amsterdam just  last week, bringing the total of Isero to 39 branches across the group.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In terms of Mainland Europe, good opportunities in The Netherlands, both organic in terms of greenfield openings  and the potential for acquisitions. And again, we see the recovery in the Dutch market being sustained for the  medium to long term. And that market does have very strong underlying fundamentals both in terms of building  and in terms of renovation work.

file: GFTUL - Q2 2017 Earnings Call 31August2017 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 31-Aug-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: It's an interesting point in Holland how they address certain things like the Green Agenda. And there are certain  cities in Holland now where you can only go into the city centers if you've got 100% electric vehicle fleet. And  you'll see here, in some of our sub-brands in both Gerritse and in Van der Winkel, we now have those fully electric  vehicle fleets in place to make sure that we can continue to deliver what our customers need in those cities where  electric vehicles are absolutely required.

GFTUL - Q4 2009 Earnings Call 4March2010 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 04-Mar-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Looking at page four, you’ll see that the vast majority of the Group’s activity is located in the  Merchanting business across Ireland and the U.K. 13% of the Group’s turnover is in DIY with 2% in  Manufacturing. More importantly I suppose in the current climate, 68% of the Group’s turnover was  generated in the U.K. with 32% in Ireland. And as we move into 2010, we’ve already seen our  turnover running at about 70% in the U.K. and 30% in Ireland.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: On page 10, the cost reduction initiatives, the total head count reduced from 10,400 at December  2008 to 9,300 at December 2009. I’ll just repeat again, we have 80 million achieved in cost savings  in 2009, and incremental cost savings in the second half of 47 million.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: On page 14, other actions taken to improve our cash, obviously we cut back significantly in capital  expenditures, you can see we incurred 12.4 million in 2009, in comparison to 78.6 million in 2008.  And we did make one small acquisition in the first half this year, a specialist distributor of solar  panels, and that type of environmentally friendly product. And that business has traded very well  during the year post acquisition.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: And there’s fairly positive demographics both in Ireland and in the U.K. which continues to keep  pressure on in terms of housing requirements and demand for our type of product across all of our  trading jurisdictions. And so on on the renewable energy initiatives being taken by the U.K.  Government in particular more recently. So, overall we feel reasonably comfortable looking forward  to the future. We don’t expect any start in recovery but we would expect to see our business  continuing to improve as we go forward.

file: GFTUL - Q4 2010 Earnings Call 3March2011 330 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Mar-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Page 18 just analyzes the cost savings between the UK and Ireland. And since we started this  program, I’ve mentioned, we have almost €100 million in annual cost reduction across the  business.

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: So, let's just have a look at revenue growth and the components of the like -for-like movements. Now, I think the  first point to observe is just around really that the weather-related aspects in the first quarter of last year. And you  can see particularly the very cold freezing weather that we had across Europe in the early months had an impact in  that first half.

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: And whilst Gavin will bring you up to speed with current trading, I think it is important to note that the UK and  Ireland, whilst we suffered with severe rain and with severe gales, that is actually better in the merchanting world  than ice and snow. So, we would expect to see more favorable first quarter comparatives in the current year.

texts.speaker: David Llewel Arnold
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: On the next slide, just looking at Belgium, overall, the Belgian economy was broadly flat but residential  construction at RMI markets were weak. And the first half, in particular, was very badly affected by the freezing  weather temperatures. The MPRO acquisition completed in February 2014 and we see this year as one o f  consolidation for our Belgian operations where we look to bring best practice from both businesses together to  form a strong platform for further development in what is a very fragmented market.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In terms of greenfield, we opened two new Selco branches last year, Old Kent Road and Wimbledon, both  performing very, very strongly. Old Kent Road opened in April 2013, Wimbledon opened in June. We also opened  two specialist merchanting branches within our core business and one general merchanting branch within  Buildbase.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: And Electricbase, we have 20 at the end of last year and we will have 35 in place by the end of Q1 this year, s o  continuing to drive into new product areas bringing new customers into the business. In terms greenfield  development, the next Selco opening will be in Isleworth. The lease and the documentation is all signed. We're  starting to fit that one out and that will open in the second half of this year.

file: GFTUL - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 10March2015 530 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 10-Mar-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.text: In terms of acquisitions, obviously, you've seen from the slide that David put up, we've got the net debt to a level  now where financially, we're in a very robust position to keep investing in opportunities that we have to grow the  business going forward. We did three small bolt-ons in the UK last year, Beaumont, Crescent and DBM, Direct  Builders Merchant, all in the Southeast. And in particular, with Beaumont, what that brings to us is a real  specialism in the timber market. We absolutely understand that in Buildbase, we can do better in timber than we  do currently. And the management, who came with Beaumont, bring a real specialist skill in terms of timber, and  we can utilize that across the broader estate in Buildbase.

file: GFTUL - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 8March2016 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-Mar-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.text: As we stand here today, from our implants, we have 80 Electricbases, 130 Hirebases, and 27 Selco Hire points.  And as we go through 2016, we'll look at the opportunity to develop, certainly, Electricbase and Hirebase. And we  will continue the roll out Selco Hire. And it's absolutely part of our plan to have Selco Hire available in every single  Selco store.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.text: We also added Carlton to our mortar manufacturing business, and without getting into too much detail, but the  market has moved in terms of bagged product and cement-based products. And what Carlton brought us was the  ability to move into waterproof packaging which is talking to our customers is where they see the market moving.  So, it was important for us to have the ability to package in waterproof, and we've now got that through Carlton.

file: GFTUL - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 7March2017 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-Mar-17.pdf
GFTUL - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 1March2018 500 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-Mar-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In terms of the future, we do believe that our capital cities are a really good place to be. And if you look at our  experience in Dublin, in London, in Edinburgh, in Brussels, in Amsterdam, capital cities really are very important  to our model. We do see the opportunity for further store openings within the Leyland SDM brand and it is a brand  that we intend to continue to use going forward. The next greenfield opening will probably be in in Hackney  sometime during the summer of this year. But we do see the opportunity for further branches to be opened within  that chain. And also the possibility to look at some kind of supply chain tie up probably with Selco to give the  customers of Leyland SDM access to a broader product range within those Central London stores. It just open up  the opportunity to look at this format in other major cities across the UK, but that will be further down the road  once we've really got out our business and supply chain firmly established within London and potential there for  opportunities for further acquisitions within that decorator's merchant segment if we can find good quality  opportunities.

texts.speaker: Gavin Slark
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer & Director, Grafton Group Plc
texts.text: In the Netherlands, we've seen benefits from increase in the scale of our business. We've now got 59 branches in  total having opened a greenfield branch in Dordrecht on February 1 of this year. And again, the overall economic  outlook in the Netherlands and the housing market in general is looking very positive. And I do believe we'll start  seeing the benefits coming through in operational efficiency in owning 100% of the Belgium business and also  hoping to see the benefits coming through in the redevelopment of the Brussels branch, which has been an  ongoing project now for nearly two years. And the formal opening of that branch takes place later in March.

GIVN - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 5August2010 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 06-Aug-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: A new captive ingredient, CASSYRANE, was introduced to our perfumers palette, an astonishing  note reminiscent of Blackcurrant and eucalyptus fruits. Its very low odor threshold makes it efficient  even at very low dosages.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The new book, The Scent of the Vanishing Flora, of our Director of Natural Scents, Roman Kaiser  will be endorsed by the Global Treaty of Convention on Biological Diversity. The research of the  Flavours division continued focusing on Health and Wellness taste solutions, in order to create  Flavours which allow reducing and replacing salt and sugar in food and beverages.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: As explained last year, we have achieved an additional 30 million in cost containment measures  implemented last year. Like the integration synergies, these savings are sustainable. By the end of  this year we will therefore have achieved overall savings of CHF230 million within the originally  expected one-off cost estimate of CHF440 million.

file: GIVN - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 4August2011 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-Aug-11.pdf
GIVN - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 3August2012 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Aug-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Gilles Andrier
texts.text: Finally, we will incur increased pension cost of CHF30 million for 2012 compared to 2011. Economic uncertainties  remain, but Givaudan's business is resilient as proven in the past and as proven in the first half of this year. As the  company enters into second half of 2012, there are many external uncertainties that may have an influence on our  business performance, such as the difficult macroeconomic climate in Europe as well as an uncertainty about the  global growth outlook for the forthcoming month. These are excellent factors Givaudan [indiscernible] (26:54) but  we have demonstrated over the recent past years the intrinsic resilience of our business and our ability to address  a challenging environment with the right strategies, actions and agility to respond and mitigate their impact.
