texts.speaker: Christian Fischer
texts.text: There, first responsible for the plastics business in China and later as Business Unit Head for entire Asia, for Fine  Chemicals and here worked very closely with customers from the pharmaceutical, cosmetics and food industry.  That experience will help me now at Gerresheimer because we want to grow in these industries especially in  emerging markets. After that, I was, for several years, responsible for research, to be precise, for materials and  systems research. And recently as President, Performance Chemicals, for a division with overall 5,000  employees, €4 billion turnover and sites across the globe.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Move on with me to slide number 7. As Christian mentioned earlier, we have not seen any significant changes in  our operating model. Overall, the underlying trends are healthy. On a reported and year-on-year basis, we have  posted a total revenues decrease of a bit less than €19 million in Q3, of which approximately €11 million is  attributable to Plastics & Devices and the remaining €8 million to Primary Packaging Glass. The trends can be  seen on the chart in the top right corner of this slide.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: What we have then tried to present on this slide are, for each division, the factors we outlined during our Q2 call  and whether these still impacted Q3. In essence, you can see that all the trends, both on the negative as well as  on the positive side, are more or less valid. If we start with the trends of Plastics & Devices, please move with me  towards the box at the bottom left corner. The totality of the sales decrease in Q3 is attributable to the Devices  business. As in precedent quarters and as previously flagged, it has to do, first, with lower tooling revenues where  we still anticipate almost half of the expected full-year revenues to come in Q4.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Looking at the trends per division, a large part of the CapEx spend in Q3 was in Plastics & Devices, mostly linked  to the acquisition of an exclusive license, enabling us to launch an innovative, integrated, passive syringe safety  solution, as well as additional investments for our Peachtree facility.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Moving on to slide number 13. On this slide, we have outlined the trends as we see them currently and which  should support the growth that we are expecting for the last quarter of the year. To be clear, we are talking about  drivers which are going to support outperformance in Q4 2017 versus Q4 2016. Plastics & Devices should  contribute for approximately 80% of the outperformance in Q4, on the basis of a solid performance year-on-year  in Devices and systems both in Europe as well as in the U.S., we are definitely expecting a much higher  production run rate in our Peachtree facility by the end of Q4. Syringes should also continue to add to the top line  in Q4.

file: GXI - Q3 2018 Earnings Call 11October2018 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-Oct-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Second, recent hike in commodity prices. For us it is essentially European gas prices which have noticeably  increased in the third quarter. We have partially hedged against this increase, but nonetheless, it has impacted  gross margin, in particular of our European moulded glass business.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Third, resin prices. Some of the oil-based derivatives we use for our plastic packaging raw materials saw their  prices further increase in the quarter. For some of our business, such as for example, Centor, we have pass- through clauses in place, but the impact is always recorded with a certain time lag of couple of months, which also  partially explains the drag on Plastics & Devices profitability.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: With regards to Plastics & Devices, adjusted EBITDA was down by short of €1 million. There were a number of  factors leading to that. First, the increase of resin prices and the fact that there's always a time lag between the  increase in raw material prices and the effective increase in prices for given customers in plastic packaging.  Second, margin of our syringes business which was affected by the timing of demand in Q3, and then here again,  if we look at our contract manufacturing performance, we have to single out the following items.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Turning on now to the adjusted EBITDA in Primary Packaging Glass. Here, we had a total contribution in the  amount of €2.1 million in the quarter. On the positive side, the higher capacity utilization in the U.S. definitely  improved the margin in both the moulded and tubular glass businesses. However, in particular for moulded glass,  higher gas prices weighted on gross margin and hence adjusted EBITDA. Just a few words on this here, we are  seeing the highest gas prices recorded in Europe since 2014.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: The average price since 2014 is €19 per megawatt hour and the prices are currently above €27. For 2018, 50% of  our energy costs have been hedged. This is by the way always our approach to start the year. And we will also do  so for 2019. In certain stages of the year, we compare the spot market with the future market prices and decide  whether we hedge or not for the other 50%.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: In the last five years always in summer, the future market prices went down, and therefore, we normally hedge  the rest. So, in 2018, gas market prices have been quite high compared to historic levels. Future gas prices were  lower and so business decided not to hedge. Unfortunately, gas prices kept rising, so hindsight, it would have  been better to hedge, but afterwards, you're always smarter. So stick to our internal rules even if the prices are  high. We have started to hedge up to the year end to get the 50% energy costs in for next year.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Overall, both impacting Plastics & Devices and Primary Packaging Glass are the additional investments we are  continuing to make [ph] and create (00:19:26) solutions as this commercial outlet, although the bulk of the  investment lines was in Primary Packaging, Plastics & Devices currently. The rest of the chart shows the impact  of the network charges. And if you add up the negative contribution from GAT which is in the amount of €2 million,  then you'll land at €76.1 million. Regarding Sensile given the nature of the revenues and the costs that the  company has, essentially people, marketing, IT and building, then it is a normal development for this quarter.

file: GXI - Q4 2010 Earnings Call 10February2011 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 10-Feb-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: In Life Science Research, similar to Moulded Glass, we expect normal growth rates, given that we  consider no kind of restocking to happen in 2011. We are clearly committed to achieve our  sustainable margin target of 15% adjusted EBITDA by the end of the year 2011. Other than that,  we will have two furnace repairs, which we have scheduled in the first half of 2011, one in Tubular  Glass and the other one in Moulded Glass.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: To sum it up, I expect 2011 to be a good year for Gerresheimer. At constant currencies, we expect  revenues to grow between 3% and 4% and an adjusted EBITDA margin of about 20%. CapEx will  be a little higher than last year at about €80 million. Since we have scheduled two furnace repairs,  and we are going to do initial investments in our new RTF line and an expansion of our Technical  Competence Center for Plastic Systems in Wackersdorf, which will fuel growth in the future.

file: GXI - Q4 2011 Earnings Call 8February2012 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-Feb-12.pdf

texts.profession: Thank you, Jürgen. Moving on to slide 15, I would like to focus for a minute on explaining our unique setup. Our
texts.text: Wherever we melt glass, furnace overhaul are part of the business. The good thing about furnace overhaul is that  with each major overhaul, we increase productivity and decrease emissions. In the first half of 2012, we will  overhaul one furnace in the Tubular Glass and two in the Moulded Glass. We decided to increase the melting  capacity of one of the furnace in Moulded Glass by which we, of course, enhance the overhaul capacity of Moulded  container production.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.profession: Thank you, Jürgen. Moving on to slide 15, I would like to focus for a minute on explaining our unique setup. Our
texts.text: Given that we have excellent growth opportunities especially in our Plastic Systems division, we plan to invest  about €100 million which represent about 8.5% of revenue, a number only slightly higher than our investment  corridor of 7% to 8% of revenue that you are familiar with.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff

file: GXI - Q4 2013 Earnings Call 13February2014 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 14-Feb-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: Two of our divisions, Plastic Systems and Moulded Glass, recorded an excellent performance. With record top and  bottom line figures, both Plastic Systems and Moulded Glass had a very strong first half of the year and recorded a  normal development in the second half of the year.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: I would like to spend a few words on how we responded to the market in 2013's megatrends, such as population  growth, demographic change, and environmental changes are setting the course for global growth. Accordingly,  these trends by the means of ever-growing needs for health services around the world having a direct impact on  our customers in the pharma, healthcare and cosmetic industries.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: To start with, the Plastic Systems margin went up strongly to 23.7 % that's really high as it includes the other  operating income related to the Triveni put options that I talked about earlier, because Triveni is part of the  Plastic Systems business. But nonetheless, it does not have anything to do with trading in Plastic Systems in full  year 2013, so we need to strip that out for a meaningful comparison.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: The RTF syringe business, we managed to bring the relevant scrap rates down significantly but still we involved  costs to assure these high levels of quality were too high and that is reflected in the lower margin year-over-year.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: On slide 15, that's our new divisional structure, the new divisions are Plastics & Device, which is headed by  Andreas Schütte; and Primary Packaging Glass, which is under my responsibility. Life Science Research, this  division is unchanged, and it is run by Rainer, which is in addition to the CFO function.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: We have provided full year 2013 numbers at a pro forma setup. What you can see in brief, Plastics & Devices  characteristics revenues of about €560 million. It's a growth driver of our group. The adjusted EBITDA margin in  2013 stood at 21.5%, but this incorporate the other operating income from the evaluation of the Triveni put  option. Excluding that, it's 20.2%. It's a division with 100% pharma focus.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: In Primary Packaging Glass, we are scheduled to start construction of our own greenfield Indian vial plant in  Kosamba, after having acquired two leading local players in India back in 2012, one for moulded pharma bottles  and one for plastic packaging container and plastic closures. This will round off our strategy to exp and our  business into India. We will have our complete offering in the Primary Packaging available in India for the  pharmaceutical industry, which is clearly one of our most important market in the future for us.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: In our Plastics & Devices division, we will focus on capacity expansion in our plants in the U.S. and in the Czech  Republic. In the U.S., we will expand our production facility, and afterwards we will initiate production of the new  inhaler.

file: GXI - Q4 2014 Earnings Call 11February2015 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-Feb-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: Better medical care in highly populated emerging markets also means growth in business volume for our  company. This is by the way exactly the rationale behind the decision to build a new greenfield plant in Kosamba  India. But it's not just about primary packaging product in the emerging markets, we decided to enhance our value  proposition when we opened a new Technical Competence Center in China last year. The Technical Competence  Center aims to serve growing needs for development of drug delivery devices in emer ging market. That said,  financial year 2014 was also a year with high investment, the base that we can build upon as we move ahead.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: On a divisional level, let's start with Plastics & Devices, and here you can see basically the same thing as on group  level. In reported terms, the margin was a bit softer as it decreased from 21.5% to 21.1%. But in the line below, you  can see that excluding the Triveni effect I just mentioned, the margin was actually up from 20.2% to 20.7% and  this is despite the highest share of tooling and engineering revenues year-over-year. So also in the Plastics &  Devices division, our profitability went up. In Primary Packaging Glass, the margin amounted to 21.6% and  practically remains on the prior year's level of 21.7%. This means that o ur very high cost discipline in that segment  paid off, as we managed to effectively mitigate the effects coming from the temporary adjustment of production  volume at some of our U.S. customers.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: Last year, we decided on four big initiatives in Plastics & Devices. The time bar for this project is outlined here in  the chart. We got started last year with a clear focus on capacity expansion in our plant in the U.S. and in the  Czech Republic. In the U.S., we built a new production hall last year. We are setting up the cleanroom this year.  And we'll start production in 2016. In the Czech Republic, we built a new production building and a cleanroom  last year. This year is about validation and start of production. In 2016, we will benefit from scaling up production.  With our third Technical Competence Center that we opened in China last year, we clearly addressed the  developing as consistent in the emerging markets. It's probably nothing we are going to make money on in the  next two years, as an investment in the future over the next five years to 10 years.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: After having acquired two leading local players in India back in 2012, one for molded glass pharma and one for  plastic packaging containers and plastic closures, this will now round off our portfolio for Primary Packaging  product in India. So we will have a complete offering for all those products available once that facility is started  up, which is extremely important for us. In 2015, we will have ramp up cost for the new facility in India since we  need to hire and train people and need to get the facility approved.

file: GXI - Q4 2015 Earnings Call 11February2016 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 11-Feb-16.pdf

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: We made a value-enhancing disposal such as the sale of our former Glass Tubing business to Corning and with  Centor, the U.S. market leader for plastic packaging for oral prescription medications, we cond ucted our biggest  M&A deal in our company's history.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: In the Plastics & Devices division, organic growth was 2.8% and reported revenues increased by 7.8%. This is a  decent growth rate which was driven by plastics, primary packaging in Europe as well as our Medical Plastic  Systems, where inhalers, insulin pens and diabetes care product posted good growth rate.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Other than that, we've closed our Millville plant in Q3 as part of our efforts to optimize our portfolio and are now  focusing all our U.S. molded glass effort on our Chicago plant. So, considering the circumstances, we had a good  year both in Plastic and Primary Packaging Glass.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Let's just have a quick look at the components of our new structure at the end of full year 2015 on the right -hand  side of this chart. First positioned on top in light blue the new Schuldschein emission that we concluded in  November, the total amount here was €425 million. It consists of tranches of 5 years, 7 years and 10 years to  maturity and the interest rates are between 0.75% variable interest rate for 5 years and 2.04% fixed coupon for 10  years on that debt. And you can see – you can read all details in our Annual Reports on the pages 113 to 115.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Secondly, in the darker blue, you see our corporate bond in the amount of €300 million which matures in May  2018. And finally, the third big position in green represents the €232.8 million in our new revolving credit facility  that we put in place in June 2015.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Secondly, the disposal of the Glass Tubing business leads to lower CapEx requirement becau se we do not need to  maintain six furnaces that we sold as part of the Glass Tubing sale anymore. Uwe will give you some more color on  that in a minute.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.text: Centor, as part of Plastics & Devices Division will generate a full year of adjusted EBITDA contributions compared  to the Q4 2015 contribution of approximately €11 million.

file: GXI - Q4 2016 Earnings Call 15February2017 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Feb-17.pdf

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Primary Packaging Glass Division, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Moving on to primary plastic packaging, we wanted to also talk about an interesting product launch namely our  BioPack. This is Gerresheimer's first eco-friendly plastic container for pharmaceutical and cosmetic application, it  makes an excellent substitute for traditional PE and PET because it has the same properties, but it is completely  recyclable.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Life Science Research Division, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Regarding energy and raw material costs on the other hand, here we have some mitigation mechanism through  our pass-through clauses in plastics and devices. Now, looking at pricing, I very often get the question about  pricing pressures on clients and how it impact us and my view is that actually I see pricing primarily as a function  of volume. And from that angle, I'm open to consider pricing decrease in exchange a higher set of volumes for  given products as we are repeatedly saying, we are a volume producer and for us, it is all about increasing our  contribution margin.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer, Life Science Research Division, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Before we start slide 16, I wanted to draw your attention on the Life Science Research impact. In our balance  sheet, the Life Science Research assets are not included in the full year 2016, our cash flow statements includes  the Life Science Research fully, fully, until the closing of the transaction.

texts.speaker: Uwe Röhrhoff
texts.profession: Chief Executive Officer, Primary Packaging Glass Division, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: Thanks, Rainer, for explaining those complicated bookkeeping activities. I'm not really sure that I have as always  have to better understand the numbers. So, maybe instead, we talk a few minutes about how we see the market  and the environment and we continue to evolve within an environment which is on the one hand driven by long- term growth drivers such as globalization, population increase, but also with our pharma and healthcare industry  supported by specific megatrends. All these factors have different dynamics and implications for our business.

file: GXI - Q4 2017 Earnings Call 22February2018 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 23-Feb-18.pdf

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: At the division level, Plastics & Devices decreased by 1.1% on a reported basis and by 1.4% organically. The  main reason for the decrease lies as America plastic systems business. As we already announced at the  beginning of the financial year, there was lower demand from a number of Pharma customers where  Gerresheimer is sole supplier. This effect was compounded by a fall in demand in the inhalation business even if  we saw a good contribution stemming from our new inhaler business at the end of Q4 2017. The other part of the  business performed in line with our expectations.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.profession: Chief Financial Officer & Speaker of the Management Board, Gerresheimer AG
texts.text: We have decided that our site in Bünde, Germany will now be the central production place for the RTU vials  because we can leverage, in particular, the ready-to-fill expertise of the teams there. So we are now installing a  new vial washing and packaging production line where we will be using the patented packaging systems from  Ompi.

file: GXI - Q4 2018 Earnings Call 14February2019 900 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 14-Feb-19.pdf

texts.speaker: Dietmar Siemssen
texts.text: On the negative side, this will, of course, impact our expected revenues from 2020 onwards. From a profitability  standpoint, it's – will not affect us in the same way as the specific project was planned with lower margin. Next to  the communicated projects during the acquisition, we see the potential for further application from the state-of- the-art system that we acquired with Sensile. And last, we should not forget about how obvious the synergies are  between Medical Plastics Systems and Sensile. In the future, it is clear that we will establish Medical Plastics  Systems as internal contract manufacturer to Sensile.

texts.speaker: Dietmar Siemssen
texts.text: Another exciting area of investment is getting ready for small batch production in glass and also for Sensile in our  technical competence center in Wackersdorf; as well as the Plastics & Devices in the U.S. with a space  enlargement of our technical center in Peachtree City. And finally, we want to drive more automation  standardization as well as capacity expansion in PPG, means in the glass business. What we do here is we are  boosting up the quality and the productivity in this segment. So as you can hear, there's a lot of dynamic in the  company and we are moving things forward.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: On the adjusted EBITDA side, we have documented the adjustments related to Triveni and the network charges  this year. So, on that basis, adjusted EBITDA remains at par compared to last year on a currency-neutral basis,  that is at €307.5 million compared to €307.2 million last year. This is a good performance when you consider that  we have lost close to €6 million due to higher gas prices and close to €5 million due to higher resin prices as  documented in our Annual Report. At Sensile, the timing of certain projects led to a better adjusted EBITDA than  expected, and we fell short of €2 million against revenue targets given at the time of the acquisition. As mentioned  by Dietmar, timeline can always vary as it is in a project-related business. All other metrics were in line with our  guidance corridor.

texts.speaker: Rainer Beaujean
texts.text: Let's come to gas prices. Our costs have been higher by approximately €6 million year-on-year. We have hedged  at the end of – at the end and already up to now approximately 65% of our expected gas volume for 2019. I think  the rest is straightforward as a result of higher or lower capacity utilization in our divisions and for the nature of  revenues of Sensile Medical.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2010 Earnings Call 4May2010 1000 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-May-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The global construction market during the first quarter of 2010 represented two different pictures.  While most emerging markets continue to grow, heavy snowfall and the weak economy further  restrained construction activity in Europe and North America. Holcim performed well and achieved  organic growth; in March in particular the Group produced better results than in 2009.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Now let us move to our regional overview starting with Europe. Large parts of the regions were  affected by cold temperatures and heavy snowfall until mid March [inaudible] of construction activity  in most markets. Overall, sales volumes in Europe declined in our segments. Operating EBITDA  increased by 15.1% to CHF137 million, including CHF65 million from the sale of CO2 emission  certificates.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The U.S. construction sector made no significant progress as heavy snowfall as well as prolonged  rain hampered the construction activities in North America. As a result Holcim U.S. and Aggregate  Industries U.S. posted weak volumes in all the segments. In contrast, Canada benefited from  positive rather compared to the previous year and the construction sector shows increased signs of  recovery supported by the government stimulus programs, which eventually led to significantly  move cement, aggregates and ready-mix concrete sales volumes at Holcim Canada.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Group region Asia Pacific got off to a flying start at the beginning of the year, with virtually all Group  companies increasing their deliveries. In India in particular, the drive to make progress on  infrastructure projects, the global housing boosted demand for building materials. The construction  sector also remained on track for growth in Vietnam, the Philippines and Indonesia. In India, ACC  saw a temporary dip in cement shipments owing to production bottlenecks, limited rail freight  capacity and a shortage of granulated blast furnace slag. By contrast Ambuja Cement increased its  domestic sales significantly. In the first quarter of 2010, new cement and clinker grinding capacity  was commissioned at three production sites and more new capacity will be added during the  course of the year. For this reason, the Indian companies are ideally equipped for the predicted  market close.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2011 Earnings Call 4May2011 1000 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 04-May-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Once again, the global construction market tended to record two different developments in the first  quarter of 2011. While the emerging markets of Asia and Latin America experienced continued  growth of the economic climate and demand for building materials, some mature markets  witnessed postponed of infrastructure projects ready for execution. On the positive side, Europe  benefited from a mild winter that offered some demand.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: 2 EBITDA declined by 17.1% to CHF753 million, mainly driven by negative currency impacts of  CHF73 million, the delayed sales of CO2 emissions certificates, amounting to CHF65 million in the  first quarter of 2010 and considerable input cost increases for raw materials and energy sources,  such as coal, petcoke in addition to region distribution costs. On a like-for-like basis and excluding  the aforementioned items, therefore, the operating EBITDA declined by only 1.8%.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Net income grew by 85.1% to CHF122 million, while the share of net income attributable to  shareholders of Holcim rose by 114.2% to CHF10 million. The main drivers was the non-recurring  cash-neutral tax charge amounting to CHF182 million in connection with the restructuring of the  group’s interest in North America in the first quarter of 2010. On the other hand, the first quarter of  2010 was positively impacted by the already mentioned sales of CO2 emissions certificates.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Now let us move to our regional overview starting with Europe. Large parts of the region benefited  from mild weather conditions that favorably impacted the construction activity in the first quarter of  2011. As a result, demand for building materials picked up in nearly all markets. The recovery was  mainly driven by the private sector, while the public sector construction continued to suffer from  budget restrictions. Overall, sales volumes in Europe increased in all segments at double-digit  rates.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The operating EBITDA decreased by 45.4% to CHF75 million on a like-for-like basis and excluding  the aforementioned sales of CO2 emissions certificates, operating EBITDA increased slightly from  CHF137 million to CHF140 million.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The U.S. noted an increase in construction activity and cement consumption. However, the  individual market regions witnessed considerable fluctuations while the majority of the states  recorded an increased level of consumption.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Various stimulus programs marked the development, particularly in the road building sector. Holcim  U.S. sold more cement despite partially poor weather conditions while Aggregate Industries U.S.  shipments of aggregates benefited from major government investments in road building, exceeding  expectations particularly in the Mid-Atlantic region.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Operating EBITDA decreased by 12.5% to CHF217 million, mainly driven by higher production  costs and the particular recent thermal energy costs. On a like-for-like basis, the operating EBITDA  declined by some 4.4%.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: In Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Bangladesh, Thailand, Malaysia and Vietnam, the construction factor  remained on its growth track. The floods in Australia and the earthquake in New Zealand caused  setbacks in the shipments of building materials. Overall, all segments recorded volume growth in  group region Asia Pacific.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: The operating EBITDA decreased by 7.1% to CHF472 million while the growth of the operating  EBITDA on a like-for-like base amounted to 0.9%. This development was mainly due to prices  increases that we’re not able to offset the rising raw materials and obtain distribution costs. Despite  the floods in the east of Australia, Cement Australia significantly exceeded its previous year’s result  by Holcim Australia only just fell short of its operating result recorded in the first quarter of 2010.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2012 Earnings Call 9May2012 630 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 09-May-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Due to good economic conditions in Asia and Latin America, and growing demand for construction materials in  North America and Africa, Middle East, consolidated cement deliveries increased. Higher shipments were  achieved particularly by the Group Companies in India, in the USA, in Thailand, the Philippines, Indonesia as well  as in Russia and Azerbaijan. However, in contrast to last year's mild climate, the harsh winter brought many  construction sites in Western and Eastern Europe to a temporary standstill in February. Hence, sales volumes  decreased in this Group region in all segments and impacted first quarter results.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Compared with Q1 2011 consolidated cement sales increased by 6.2% to 35.2 million tonnes and deliveries of  aggregates were down by 7.8% to 31.6 million tonnes. Volumes of ready-mix concrete decreased by 0.3% to 10.4  million cubic meters while asphalt sales declined by 18.4% to 1.4 million tonnes. Reshipments of cement up by  more than 1.8 million tonnes. Asia Pacific was well ahead in terms of volume mainly due to India.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: With the exception of Europe, all Group regions performed better. Sales of CO2 emission certificate amount to  CHF6 billion compared to zero sales a year ago. The operating EBITDA margin reached 15.7% down from 6.2% a  year ago while on a like-for-like basis, the margin reached 16.0%.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2013 Earnings Call 8May2013 430 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 08-May-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Market and weather-induced decreases in sales volumes in all segments and the higher variable costs impacted  the operating results. Price improvements, cost savings, primarily in fixed costs in Europe and Latin America, and  the sale of a stake of 25% in Cement Australia compensated for this. And as a result, Holcim was able to report an  increase in net income in the first quarter. This success was substantially supported by the Holcim Leadership  Journey.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Sales of ready-mix concrete declined by 16.8% to 8.4 million cubic meters. However, this decline was mainly due  to restructuring measures. Asphalt sales contracted by 17.7% to 1.1 million tons. Consolidated net sales were 7.2%  lower at CHF4.3 billion. Operating EBITDA fell by 9.5% to CHF650 million. The main reason for this  development was the lower performance of both Indian Group companies.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2014 Earnings Call 28April2014 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 28-Apr-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Let me now turn to the operational results in a bit more detail. In the first three months of 2014, Holcim increased  like-for-like sales volumes in all segments. Particularly strong results came from Europe where exceptionally mild  weather conditions led to an unusually dynamic building activity. The market situation in India slowly began to  stabilize, translating into flat cement volumes, while Mexico gradually recovered, boasting slightly higher volumes  than one year ago.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: In ready-mix concrete, volumes contracted by 2% to 8.2 million cubic meters, and increases in a number of  European countries could not compensate the lower volumes resulting from the segment's restructuring in 2013.  Asphalt volumes reached 1.4 million tonnes, an increase of 23.3%.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Let me now come back to another very important recent event. At the beginning of April, Holcim and Lafarge  announced their intention to combine the two companies through a merger of equals. This new global company  with European roots will deliver compelling benefits for all stakeholders. LafargeHolcim would be in the best  position to contribute to addressing the challenges of urbanization: affordable housing, urban sprawl and  transport. The new group would increase its offer to customers through innovation delivered on an expanded  scale, best-in-class R&D, and a combined portfolio of solutions and products.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Both companies have pioneered sustainability and climate change mitigation in the industry and are committed to  take it to the next level. After a strategic optimization of the portfolio through a proactive divestment process and  in anticipation of regulatory requirements, LafargeHolcim will be the geographically most balanced company in  the building materials sector, positioned best to serve our customers' need to no matter where they need it.

file: HCMCF - Q1 2015 Earnings Call 30April2015 500 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Apr-15.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Now, the operational results for the first three months of this year, and they're summarized as follows:  Consolidated cement volumes decreased 5.5% to 31.2 million tonnes in the first three months of the year. While  North America and Latin America increased cement volumes, the other group regions reported declines.  Aggregate volumes increased 1.2% to 29.5 million tonnes as the volume growth in Europe and North America was  able to make up for the negative development in other group regions. Ready-mix concrete deliveries reached 8  million cubic meters, a decline of 2%, which was mainly attributable to less favorable development in Latin  America, where the focus remained on high-margin applications, and North America. Asphalt sales were up  markedly by 14.9% to 1.6 million tonnes. Group cement prices increased by 4% in Q1 2015 compared with Q1  2014, while aggregate prices were up by 4.2%.

file: HCMCF - Q2 2010 Earnings Call 19August2010 1000 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 19-Aug-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: After our first quarter beset by heavy rain to snowfall in the Northern hemisphere, the overall  economic picture improved slightly. However, one cannot speak of a global economic recovery.  Elements of uncertainty still exist. These include high level of government debt which are limiting  further stimulus programs particularly in Europe. Even though the US economy has improved the  upturn is not yet broadly based. Despite this environment, Holcim has performed well. Measures to  cut costs and boost efficiency continued Group-wide. Despite the commissioning of approximately  5 million tons of new cement capacity, fixed costs on a like-for-like basis were reduced compared  with the same period a year ago.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: Cement sales by ACC, they are not quite able to match the previous year’s high level due to a  combination of shortages of granulated slag for the production of composite cements, limited  availability of rail and road haulage services and delays in commissioning of new capacity.

texts.speaker: Operator
texts.text: In contrast domestic cement sales at Ambuja Cements benefited from the additional clinker  grinding capacities. Overall sales volumes in Group region Asia Pacific increased in all the  segments also supported by additional contribution from the acquired Australian businesses.

file: HCMCF - Q2 2011 Earnings Call 18August2011 1000 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 18-Aug-11.pdf

texts.speaker: Markus Johann Akermann
texts.text: The operating EBITDA declined by 19% to CHF1.9 billion mainly driven by negative currency impacts amounting  to CHF276 million or 11.8%. Largely absent sales of CO2 emission certificates of CHF65 million year-on-year on a  net basis, and considerable cost increases for fuel, thermal energy, raw material, and distribution costs. On a like- for-like base the operating EBITDA declined by 7.2% or 4.6% when adjusting for the CO2 emission certificate  sales. The operating EBITDA margin reached 18.7%, down from 21.5% a year ago. The cash flow from operating  activities decreased to CHF72 million predominantly due to the seasonality – seasonally higher net working  capital requirements in line with the strong volume growth, one-off tax credits in the previous year, and lower  operating EBITDA.

texts.speaker: Markus Johann Akermann
texts.text: Net income decreased by 4.2% to CHF586 million, while the share of net income attributable to shareholders of  neutral tax charge amounting to CHF186 million, in connection with the restructuring of the group's interest in  North America in the first quarter of 2010. While on the other hand, the first six months of 2010, were positively  impacted by the already mentioned sales of CO2 emission certificates in addition to higher minority interest  income levels.

file: HCMCF - Q2 2012 Earnings Call 15August2012 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Aug-12.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Consolidated cement sales increased by 4.4% to 74 million tons. Deliveries of aggregates declined by 7% to 75.6  million tons and ready-mix concrete volumes by 1.3% to 22.8 million cubic meters. Sales of asphalt decreased  mainly in Europe by 16.2% to 3.6 million tons. With an increase in cement deliveries of 3.1 million tons, Asia  Pacific was the strongest Group region. North and Latin America as well as Africa Middle East also recorded gains.  The top performer in the aggregate segment was North America mainly due to Holcim Canada.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: The sale of CO2 emission certificates totaled CHF15 million compared to CHF1 million in the same period last  year. On a like-for-like basis, especially excluding changes in the scope of consolidation and exchange rates, the  Group grew by 6.3% at the operating EBITDA level in the first half of the year and 6.9% in the second quarter.

file: HCMCF - Q2 2013 Earnings Call 15August2013 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 15-Aug-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Global economic growth in the first six months of 2013 was weaker than foreseen. Construction activity was hurt  by the severe winter as well as the bad weather encountered in many regions. Demand fell short of expectations in  India, Canada, Mexico and Morocco in particular. By contrast, the economic climate was significantly better in the  Philippines and Ecuador, among other markets.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Consolidated cement sales were down 3.7% to 68.6 million tonnes. Deliveries of aggregates declined by 7.2% to  69.4 million tonnes, and ready-mix concrete volumes decreased by 15% to 18.8 million cubic meters. Asphalt sales  were down by 8.3% to 3.3 million tonnes because of North America.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: The group companies in Ecuador, Azerbaijan and Russia reported significant increase in cement sales, while  deliveries of aggregates were up at Holcim Switzerland and also Aggregate Industries UK. Upturn in ready-mix  concrete sales were recorded by Holcim Indonesia, Holcim Malaysia and Holcim Ecuador. Price development in  all regions continue to be positive, with the exception of Europe.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Group regions, Europe and Latin America achieved better results. On the positive news front, fixed costs were  lower. The price environment was in many cases stable or slightly better. Proceeds from the sales of CO2 emission  certificates were down by CHF 10.3 million in Europe.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Let us now turn to the outlook. Holcim anticipates an increase in sales of cement in 2013, but the group doesn't  expect to reach the previous year's level in the aggregates and ready-mix concrete businesses. While group regions  Asia Pacific and Latin America are expected to witness higher cement sales volumes, Holcim is somewhat less  optimistic with regard to Europe and Africa Middle East. In North America, cement sales are expected to reach  similar levels to the previous year.

file: HCMCF - Q2 2014 Earnings Call 30July2014 300 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 30-Jul-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Aggregates volumes increased slightly by 0.2% to 69.6 million tonnes, which is mainly attributable to improved  results in North America and Asia Pacific. Like-for-like, the increase was 1%. Ready -mix concrete volumes were  down 3.9% to 18.1 million cubic meters, with growth in several European countries unable to compensate for  volume declines in Latin America that were caused by the restructuring of the segment in 2013. Asphalt volumes  increased by 21.8% to 4.1 million tonnes.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: North America. In the U.S., economic recovery was by far less rigorous than expected, despite the  stimulus programs. In Canada however, better economic activity has given impetus to the  construction industry. Besides insufficient demand for construction materials in the U.S.,  unfavorable weather conditions put further pressure on the whole construction sector.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Nevertheless, Cement sales at Holcim U.S. remained more or less stable. Aggregate Industries  U.S. recorded a fall in the volume of shipments of aggregates and ready-mix concrete. A certain  level of demand was sustained by large project on the Atlantic coast, as well as in the Midwest.  Holcim Canada sold more Cement and Ready-mix concrete. Sales of aggregates reached the  previous year’s level.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Thanks to the better economic situation, Cement prices picked up slightly in Canada, and in the  U.S. Cement prices stabilized, but at the low level still. The drastic cost reductions achieved in both  group companies in the U.S., as well as the very good efficiency of the new cement plant Ste.  Genevieve on the Mississippi, positively impacted operating results of this group region. Together  with the increased results of Holcim Canada operating EBITDA recorded again strong organic  growth after a long interruption.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Latin America. In general, the construction sector in Latin America proved relatively resistant to the  crisis. Especially in South America, construction activity remained solid, with a particularly large  volume of work in Brazil and Argentina. However, weak economic activity as well as hurricanes and  record rainfalls led to a weak demand for construction materials in Mexico. Therefore, Holcim  Apasco sold less cement. It increased however, deliveries of aggregates and ready-mix concrete.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: In Central America, less cement was sold as well. In Brazil, the robust state of the economy  strengthened demand for building materials. Holcim Brazil has experienced a continuous rise in  sales of Cement and Aggregates since the start of the year. In Argentina, Minetti also increased  Cement sales. In Chile, Cemento Polpaico recorded lower Cement sales in a difficult market  environment. Initial measures to rectify major damage of the earthquake resulted in an increase in  deliveries of aggregates and ready-mix concrete.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Fortunately, Cement prices remained relatively stable and the group companies in Brazil and  Argentina recorded substantially better results. However, this could not offset the worsening  business climate, particularly in Mexico. Before year end, we will go on stream with an efficient  cement plant in Hermosillo, a growth region in the Northwest part of Mexico, thus reducing logistic  costs long term.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Africa, Middle East. This group region developed positively overall. In Lebanon, the favorable  investment climate was conducive to residential construction activity, as well as infrastructure  expansion projects.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: And finally, to Asia-Pacific. Demand remained dynamic in many markets. Supported by the full  consolidation of Cement Australia and Holcim Australia, the group could not only increase cement  sales, but also deliveries of aggregates and ready-mix concrete.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Cement Australia was able to just match the previous year’s high sales volumes. At Holcim  Australia, project delays for big infrastructure projects and unfavorable weather conditions, as well  as the subdued economic activity, especially in the state of Queensland, impacted negatively on  sales of Aggregates and Ready-mix concrete.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: Some markets also experienced a certain price pressure. This is true for the Ready-mix concrete  business in Australia, but particularly for India, where cement prices in the third quarter as usual in  the monsoon season, came under pressure.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: We have also commissioned nearly 5 million tonnes of cement capacity in India thus far this year.  Relatively good performance was achieved from our other group company in India, as well as those  in the Philippines and Indonesia.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to our Autumn 2010 presentation. Those
texts.text: In India, demand for building materials is expected to come back to a normal growth level following  the monsoon and the Diwali festivals. It will be challenging for the group to reach the previous  year’s operating EBITDA. Holcim continues to place a strong emphasis on strengthening its cost  and environmental efficiency and competitiveness.

file: HCMCF - Q3 2011 Earnings Call 9November2011 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 09-Nov-11.pdf

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Markus Johann Akermann  Chief Executive Officer, Holcim Ltd.  Ladies and gentlemen, we are pleased to welcome you to the Presentation of our Results for the Third Quarter of  2011. As always, we shall concentrate on the financial aspects of Holcim. Today, however, following my comments  on the key developments within the group, I will give you a brief introduction to our new energy fund, which was  set up in 2010.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The aim of the fund, which will be allocated around CHF 100 million annually from the sale of CO2 emission  certificates is to improve the energy efficiency of our plants on a sustained basis and thus, reduce also CO2  emissions. Our CFO, Thomas Aebischer will follow on with a commentary on the group's financial results and  before we move on to the discussion, I will say a few words about the outlook. Finally, we will be happy to answer  any questions you have.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The strong Swiss franc impacted operating EBITDA by CHF 458 million, also still outstanding sales of CO2  emissions certificate in Europe, compared with the previous year had a negative influence. Cost, which could be  influenced, but nevertheless kept well under controlled.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: As per end of September, there was a decline in operating EBITDA due to above average inflation for energy,  transport and raw materials. This cost increase is good for the time being only, partially, be passed on to sale  prices due to strong competitive pressures in many markets.  On a like-for-like basis, operating EBITDA was higher than last year in Latin America and Asia Pacific. Europe pay  out less well, mainly because of the still outstanding sales of CO2 certificates in the U.S. The ongoing insufficient  demand for construction materials and the stabilization of prices at the low level both impacted results.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: In Italy, there were deconsolidations in the aggregates and ready-mix concrete business, while in Spain, our group  company decided to close further 25 ready-mix concrete plans.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: In Eastern and Southeastern Europe, a few infrastructure projects made a positive impact on demand. Most group  companies increased their shipments of cement. About a week ago, we have increased our minority stake in a  company in Eastern Slovakia, which owns a cement plant and several aggregates in ready-mix concrete operations  in toward majority. This compliments our network in this region.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Operating EBITDA for group region, Europe, decreased. The results were depressed by the weak euro and still  outstanding sales of CO2 emission certificates. Many group companies were only partially able to offset the rise in  energy, distribution of raw material cost risk price increases.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: On balance, Holcim Canada sold less cement than ready-mix concrete. Volumes increased in the aggregate  cement, but there was less demand for high-grade gravel and prices came under pressure.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Expenses were also incurred for the temporary closure of the Catskill plant. Due to increased production cost,  Aggregate Industries U.S. recording – recorded lower results. At Holcim Canada, rising price pressure,  particularly in the ready-mix concrete business and higher cement manufacturing costs had a negative impact on  financial results.  Now to Latin America. In Latin America, the economy made positive headway in most countries. Numerous  infrastructure projects above the demand for building materials. All group companies sold more cement and  nearly all also increased their sales of aggregates and ready-mix concrete.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Holcim Ecuador also increased deliveries of construction materials due to brisk road building and infrastructure  activity. Indeed, demand was such that clinker had to be bought in occasionally.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Despite some project delays at construction sites in Beirut, Holcim Lebanon sold slightly more cement and ready- mix concrete. The companies in the Indian Ocean sold more cement and ready-mix concrete. The group  companies in Mauritius, La Réunion and Madagascar witnessed positive volume development.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The Philippine construction sector felt the lack of public sector investment activity. The situation, nevertheless,  improved slightly from August onward. Construction activity in Oceania remained subdued. In Australia, there  was a lack of cement and concrete intensive projects. Road-building in the aftermath of the floods impacted  positively on cement demand only from the third quarter.  On balance, Cement Australia, therefore, sold less cement. Holcim Australia delivered more aggregates on both  the East and West Coasts. Operating EBITDA in group region Asia Pacific decreased. Stronger results were  achieved above all by the group companies in Thailand, Vietnam, Malaysia, Singapore and Indonesia.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Now, as announced, a few comments on this energy fund. Concrete is highly energy and CO2 efficient building  material. Globally, it is the second most consumed commodity by volume after water and vital to a functioning  infrastructure. Production of the intermediate product cement is, however, energy intensive with thermal and  electrical energy accounting for approximately 40% of the cost of production.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: In U.S. dollar terms, energy costs have risen by around 8% per year over the last five years. In addition, CO2  emissions occur, 60% of which are caused by the chemical conversion of limestone in the rotary kiln and 40% by  the use of fossil fuels. Because the European cement industry currently emits less CO2 than it is entitled to, large  sums of money are raised each year from the sale of excess emission certificates. The reasons are well known.  Sluggish European growth, but also the industry's ongoing endeavors to boost the energy efficiency of its plants  and reduce the clinker factor in cement.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Holcim is known for its leading role in these areas in particular. Holcim could simply record the proceeds,  normally some CHF 100 million every year as income. However, we decided to allocate these sums to an energy  fund that we launched in 2010.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The fund should help ensure the realization of innovative and I would like underline innovative projects across the  group in the field of heat recovery, the utilization of alternative fuels and raw materials, as well as wind power and  hydroelectricity.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The objective is clear, to save fossil fuels sources and boost energy efficiency, resulting in an improvement in our  environmental footprint and a reduction in production cost. This is particularly important against a backdrop of  rising global energy costs. The energy fund is an element in the group's comprehensive strategy for countering  these cost pressures.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Holcim has produced a list of criteria for the assessment of projects to be financed. The emphasis is on economic  efficiency, as investments need to be amortized within around one third of their lifetime, but also, on the potential  to reduce CO2 and the possibility of multiplying innovations speedily and successfully across the group. The  creation of the fund led to competition between the group companies to produce the best project proposals and  spark the whole series of new approaches for sustainable energy projects.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Last year, so funds year marked for five heat recovery plants in Vietnam, India, Romania, Lebanon and  Switzerland. These installations are under construction and will be commissioned between the end of 2011 and  2013. Six projects were approved this year. They include four waste heat recovery units in Canada, Slovakia,  Mexico and India, as well as two installations for the utilization of alternative fuels and raw materials in Germany  and France. These facilities will be commissioned in 2013 and '14.  Once completed, these units will produce a cumulative 36 megawatts of electricity, equivalent to the electricity  needs of a very large cement plant. All-in-all, Holcim will save around 200,000 tons of CO2 annually, as a result of  the projects approved to date. That is approximately as much as 1/6 of the annual CO2 emission of the city of  Zurich.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: I would like to go into a little more detail on two particular projects. Our waste heat recovery power station is  currently under construction at ACCs GAGAL plant in the mountainous region of Himachal Pradesh in India. The  new facility brings many benefits, energy savings and therefore, lower production costs, reduced CO2 emissions,  as well as a more reliable supply of electricity with low and stable costs. All these is possible without any negative  implications from production.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The waste heat recovery power station will utilize waste heat from the pre heat power and clinker cooling system.  The steam generated is used to drive the turbine, which is coupled to a generator. Commissioning is likely to take  place in the third quarter of 2012. The power station will produce 7 megawatts of electricity on a cost basis of  around 44 gigawatt hours on a net basis every year. This represents 12% to 14% of the GAGAL's plants annual  energy consumption. The investment amounts to nearly US$17 million.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Another innovative project for the more efficient use of alternative fuels and raw materials is being undertaken by  Holcim Germany at its cement plant in Lägerdorf. The project being carried out in cooperation with Polysius, a  subsidiary of ThyssenKrupp is at the very advance stage. The plan is for a multistage combustion chamber at the  kiln entrance, which unlike conventional chambers is able to utilize purely combustible and bulky alternative  fuels. Well, Kando new plant is scheduled for completion in 2013. Due to the higher proportion of alternative fuels  and raw materials in the legal non-facility to energy mix around 38,000 tons of CO2 should be saved annually  once it is commissioned.

texts.speaker: Thomas Aebischer
texts.text: Adding to this decline or the still outstanding sales of CO2 emission certificates, proceeds from the sales of  emission allowances amounted to only CHF 11 million, compared to CHF 75 million in the first nine months of  2010. Accordingly, the operating EBITDA margin declined from 21.6% to 19.2%. On a like-for-like basis, those,  excluding the currency impact in change in structure, the margin was at 19.5%.

texts.speaker: Thomas Aebischer
texts.text: The group region Europe operating EBITDA was down 17.3%, reflecting the still outstanding sale of CO2  certificates, as earlier mentioned, and weaker results in Belgium, Italy, Spain and Hungary, as well as the CHF 11  million in costs related to the closure of ready-mix concrete plants in Spain. Excluding currency movements and  change in scope, the internal operating EBITDA declined by 9.4%.

file: HCMCF - Q3 2012 Earnings Call 7November2012 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 07-Nov-12.pdf

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: These include the introduction of a leaner management structure for Europe, and the creation of a project  management office to monitor the progress of the Holcim Leadership Journey. Guidelines to measure the  operational and financial progress of the program have also been put in place. And the detailed financial impact of  the entire Holcim Leadership Journey will be released together with the year-end results 2012.  The like-for-like operating EBITDA compared with last year increased by 6.4%. This includes restructuring costs  of CHF58 million linked to the Holcim Leadership Journey. And adjusted for the costs and also eliminating the  favorable impact of CO2 sales during the nine first months of the year, the like-for-like operating EBITDA  increased by 8% compared with last year.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Due to the excellent business climate in Singapore, deliveries of ready-mix concrete did not decline significantly in  this Group region. The drop in aggregates shipment is a consequence of the subdued construction activity in the  Pacific region.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: In the ready-mix concrete area, the reduction in volume is primarily the results of an initiative to optimize the  margin in this business in Holcim Brazil. Due to weaker demand, sales volumes declined in all segments in  Argentina. The operating EBITDA of the Group region Latin America increased, despite higher input costs and the  weaker Brazilian currency. Operating margins also improved. This reflects not only the high cement sales volume  – higher cement sales volume and the better price situation, but also ongoing efforts to control the costs.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Holcim US sold more cement. Aggregate Industries U.S. increased deliveries of ready-mix concrete. However,  shipments of aggregates remained below the previous year's level, and asphalt sales declined. Holcim Canada also  sold more cement and ready-mix concrete, partly due to the favorable weather conditions for construction. Due to  delays in projects, sales of aggregates decreased and sales of asphalt remained stable.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Operating EBITDA for the Group region North America improved significantly. All three group companies  achieved better financial results, and the operating result of Holcim US and Holcim Canada improved strongly.  Aside from increase in sales volume, the reason for the improvement in margin included lower energy costs and  better prices.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Adjusting for the CHF21 million restructuring costs related to Hungary and the CHF3 million lower CO2 sales, the  margin even reached 21.2%. The operating profit benefited from the aforementioned developments, and together  with a slightly reduced depreciation and amortization increased by 13.9% to CHF762 million. Adjusting for the  CHF3 million lower CO2 sales in Europe and the one-off costs of CHF60 million related to the Holcim Leadership  Journey, the operating profit margin improved to 14.1%, up from 12.6% a year ago.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Continued efforts on the cost side resulted in fixed costs increasing under-proportionately, hence partially  compensating for the increase in variable costs related to an increase, as mentioned before, in raw materials and  energy. As a result, the operating EBITDA increased by 5.9%, or a good 6.4% on a like-for-like base. Adjusting for  the higher CO2 sales of CHF11 million and the CHF58 million restructuring costs, the operating EBITDA  increased to nearly CHF3.2 billion, yielding a margin of 19.7% compared to the stated 19.4%.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Excluding the one-off impact from the Holcim Leadership Journey of CHF98 million on operating profit level and  the aforementioned CO2 sales, the operating profit margin reached 12.1% compared to the stated 11.6%. Cash flow  from operating activities improved by a good 19.1% to CHF1.1 billion, driven by higher operating EBITDA and  lower income taxes paid.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: Adjusting for the slightly negative currency impact of minus 0.7% and the changes in the scope of consolidation of  0.1%, the operating EBITDA increased by a solid 6.4%. Excluding the impact from higher CO2 sales of CHF22  million compared to the previous year's CHF11 million, and deducting the CHF58 million related to the Holcim  Leadership Journey one-off cash costs, the like-for-like operating EBITDA increased by approximately 8%.

texts.speaker: MANAGEMENT DISCUSSION SECTION
texts.text: The Group region Europe witnessed an 18.4% decline of its operating EBITDA to CHF577 million. On a like-for- like base, this decline was only slightly lower at minus 18.2%. Restructuring costs in Europe of CHF47 million,  mainly in Spain, Hungary and the UK, negatively impacted the operating EBITDA development, while higher CO2  sales of CHF11 million had a positive impact.

file: HCMCF - Q3 2013 Earnings Call 5November2013 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 05-Nov-13.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Activity in the Australian construction industry remained modest, and Cement Australia sold less cement. At  Holcim Australia, bad weather and delays in building projects impeded the dispatch of aggregates and ready-mix  concrete. New Zealand sold less cement and roughly the same amount of aggregates as in the previous year.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Holcim Costa Rica sold more cement and ready-mix concrete, and Holcim Nicaragua registered a substantial  increase in sales of aggregates. Holcim Ecuador benefited from continuing robust building activity in the public  and private sectors and registered an increase in shipments of cement and ready-mix concretes.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: The Chilean group company reported an increase in cement sales, and ready-mix concrete prices improved  significantly in the third quarter. Holcim Argentina sold more cement and aggregates on the back of [ph] growing  (10:35) order books in the building sector.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Aggregate Industries UK succeeded in increasing deliveries of aggregates, asphalt and concrete products and  reported considerably higher earnings. Although Belgium and the Netherlands were still waiting to see some  sustainable growth in the construction sector, Holcim Belgium achieved higher cement volumes in the third  quarter.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: The challenging economic situation in France led to the local group company reporting a decrease in sales of  cement and ready-mix concrete. However, deliveries of aggregates rose. Holcim Spain was able to lift cement sales  on the strength of export deliveries. As expected, sales of aggregates and ready-mix concrete declined.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: The situation remained problematic in the Eastern European markets. With the exception of Holcim Bulgaria and  Holcim Slovakia, the group companies in this part of Europe faced declines in cement deliveries. Other segments  presented a similar picture. Holcim Azerbaijan was able to tap fully in the heavy demand for building materials  and increased both cement sales and financial results. Holcim Russia also sold more cement, albeit at lower  prices.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Now in North America, the U.S. construction industry became slightly more dynamic. While private residential  construction bounced back and construction activity in this sector increased in several regions, the challenges  confronting the public purse meant that infrastructure construction remained weak. Bad weather at the beginning  of the year also led to a late construction season start. Economic growth in Canada is slowing, and demand for  building materials is more subdued. Holcim U.S. recorded a slight decline in cement deliveries. However, the  group company achieved its highest monthly sales volume in August since 2008.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Holcim Canada was unable to fully compensate for the weather-related setbacks of the first half of the year,  experiencing lower sales volume in all three segments at the end of the nine months.

texts.speaker: Thomas Aebischer
texts.text: While aggregates show the reported volume increase of 2.2%, both cement and ready-mix volumes were down by  0.5% and 12.9%, respectively. Overall, sales prices, which generally saw only a gradual improvement, were  weighted down by markedly weaker cement prices in India and lower aggregates and ready-mix concrete prices in  Australia.

file: HCMCF - Q3 2014 Earnings Call 3November2014 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Nov-14.pdf

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Holcim Indonesia sold more volumes in cement, aggregates and ready-mix concrete. In the Philippines, demand  for building materials remained high, primarily thanks to government initiatives aimed at improving the country's  infrastructure. Subsequently, cement volumes at Holcim Philippines were significantly higher than last year.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: In Australia, the lively private housing construction market continues to drive demand for bagged cement and  ready-mix concrete. However, delays in larger construction projects caused some challenges for the local group  company.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Fewer projects from the resources sector and bad weather in New South Wales and Queensland toward the middle  of the year affected volumes at Holcim Australia. While in ready -mix concrete, higher demand from markets such  as New South Wales was able to partially mitigate these effects, aggregate volumes were below last year.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Ready-mix concrete volumes were up there as well. While Holcim Ecuador reported solid growth over the last  years, reaching an old time record in 2013, lower consumption of bagged cement and delays in large public  projects caused by liquidity constraints on the governments have led to cement volume decreases for the local  group company.

texts.speaker: Bernard Fontana
texts.text: Aggregate industries U.S. also benefited from the favorable economic climate and growth of construction markets.  Over the first nine months of the year, the group company sold more aggregates with particularly strong demand  in the West Central, Twin Cities, Fargo and Central regions. Aggregate industries U.S. recorded strong increases in  asphalt, thanks to various paving projects in most regions.

file: HCMCF - Q4 2009 Earnings Call 3March2010 600 AM ET CORRECTED TRANSCRIPT - 03-Mar-10.pdf

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: presentation. We will concentrate in our presentations on the financial aspects of Holcim. But I  would like to explicitly refer also to the Annual Report reprint which was distributed, which covers  additional topics, such as the company’s general strategy, sustainability, innovation of our  employees.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: All in all, 23 kiln lines with a production capacity of more than 10 million tons were closed. In  addition, more than 100 aggregates and ready-mix concrete plants were closed temporarily. These  moves were accompanied by a substantial reduction of our workforce, which was conducted as  socially responsible as possible.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: The new Saint Genevieve cement plant in the U.S. was commissioned as planned. Situated right  on the Mississippi River and equipped with its own port facility, the plant, which has a capacity of 4  million tons, is the largest and most modern in the U.S.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: It improves energy efficiency by around 40% compared to the U.S. sites that Holcim closed. The  plant boosts Holcim’s market presence throughout the river system of the Midwest, right down to  the Gulf of Mexico.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: The acquisition of Cemex Australia, now Holcim Australia, is a significant achievement. The  transaction also included the increase in the shareholding in Cement Australia from 50 to 75%.  Both Group companies are fully consolidated since October 2009. This means Holcim can now  offer not only cement but also aggregates, ready-mix concrete, and concrete elements in a  strategically important market.       corrected transcript

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: And now to the developments in the individual Group regions. In 2009, the recession has put  pressure on the European construction industry. Additionally, a prolonged period of cold weather,  lasting well into spring, hampered construction activity.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: However, Holcim Switzerland benefited from solid order books. Many Group companies  implemented measures to adapt production capacity to the market development. The  Torredonjimeno cement plant in Spain was permanently closed. Holcim Hungary mothballed a kiln  line at its Labatlan site, and the Pleven plant in Bulgaria will temporarily be operated only as  grinding station. At the Shurovo cement plant in Russia, no grey cement is to be produced until the  commissioning of the new production line.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: Now to North America, and compared with its 2008 level, private residential construction activity in  the US again fell by approximately one-third. Commercial construction showed an even worse  development. The situation in Canada was slightly better. Holcim US saw a significant decline in  deliveries, aggravated by a severe winter at the beginning of 2009, followed by unfavorable  weather conditions in spring and repeated floods.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: 3 Holcim Canada experienced a slump in cement exports from its Mississauga plant. In Ontario,  weak residential construction and project cancellations in the commercial and industrial sectors  affected sales volumes. Aggregate Industries US experienced a sales decline in all segments.  However, government road building programs supported sales of asphalt in the second half of  2009. Holcim US decommissioned two plants. And in the first quarter of the year, two additional  cement plants were mothballed.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: Holcim Bangladesh delivered substantially more cement, and Holcim Lanka positioned itself  successfully as a supplier of building materials to important key projects. Holcim Vietnam recorded       corrected transcript

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: 4 significantly higher deliveries of cement and ready-mix concrete. Siam City Cement in Thailand  matched the previous year’s cement delivery volumes in the domestic market and increased its  exports. In the Philippines, sales volumes showed a particularly strong increase, and Holcim  Indonesia recorded stable domestic shipments. The favorable investment climate in the region  ensured rising cement exports.

texts.speaker: Markus Akermann, Chief Executive Officer
texts.profession: Good afternoon, ladies and gentlemen. We are pleased to welcome you to our 2009 results
texts.text: Cement Australia sold less cement due to the less dynamic market and to the adverse climatic  conditions, mainly on the east coast. In New Zealand, deliveries of aggregates increased.  Operating EBITDA remarkably increased. The first time inclusion of the acquisition in Australia had  a positive impact.
